loans.name: Gaziya

texts.en:
Gaziya is a 41-year-old mother of five from the Negev. Gaziya raises sheep and sells them at market. She also sells cheese products and sheep's milk. Gaziya currently has 30 head of sheep but needs to increase her number and restock her supply.

Gaziya needs this loan to purchase more ewes and sheep to raise.

Her dream is to provide an education to all of her children, strengthening their future.

loans.use: To purchase more ewes and sheep

loans.name: Mayson

texts.en:
Mayson is 49 years old and married. She is from Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan and is a mother of four children.

Mayson is a tailor and she is operating from her home.

Mayson is requesting a loan of 600 JD to purchase an additional sewing machine for her home-based business with an aspiration of improving her business so that she can meet the increased demands for her products.

loans.use: to purchase an additional sewing machine

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 43 años, es una mujer amable, buena y trabajadora, convive con José y es madre de cuatro hijos; Rodrigo de 12, Marco de 9, Ray de 5 y la menor de 2 años Mayumi. Ella trabaja mucho para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El trabajo de María consiste en la venta de comida. Es así que a diario desde muy temprano se dirige al mercado de su distrito y ahí comienza a preparar los deliciosos platos que solo ella sabe hacer con sus ingredientes secretos. Su puesto está ubicado en el mercado y ahí van a diario muchas personas quienes buscan una buena sazón, buena atención y sobre todo limpieza. Lleva realizando su trabajo por un año, le gusta mucho ya que le permite tener y hacer muchas cosas en su vida diaria, además de generarle buenos ingresos y así puede brindar mejoras en su hogar. Ahora está en etapa de crecimiento, pues cuando inicio le fue muy complicado ya que no conocía mucho de cómo realizar éste trabajo. Solo espera en el futuro tener un restaurante y seguir con el crecimiento de su negocio. Este será el crédito número tres con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además se compromete una vez mas a apagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará ingredientes, insumos y algunos materiales que necesita para seguir realizando bien su trabajo.
texts.en: María is 43 years old.  She is kind, good, and hard-working.  She lives with her partner José and is the mother of four children; Rodrigo (12), Marco (9), Ray (5), and 2 year old Mayumi who is the youngest.  She works a great deal in order to provide her family with a better quality of life.  She works in food sales.  Everyday, very early in the morning, she goes to the district market and there she begins preparing the delicious dishes that only she knows how to make with her secret ingredients.  Her food stall is located in the  market.  Everyday, many people go there looking for good seasoning, good service, and above all, cleanliness.  She has been in this business for a year and enjoys it because it allows her to have and do many things in her daily life.  In addition, the business generates good income and thus provides home improvements.   Now she is in a stage of growth.  When she started the business, it was very complicated because didn’t know much about how to manage this business.  She hopes to have a restaurant in the future and to continue growing her business.  This will be her third loan with MFP, so she expects a small loan in order to meet her goals.  In addition, once more, she promises to be punctual with her payments.  With the requested 1500 nuevos soles, she will purchase ingredients, supplies, and some materials that she needs to continue running her business successfully.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is 54 years old and married. He is from Jabal Al Hussein, Amman, Jordan and a father of five children.

Amer has his own blacksmith and he is requesting a loan of 1,500 JD to purchase machinery needed for the blacksmith. Amer has previously borrowed from Kiva and his loan was successfully paid on time.

An aspiration of Amer's is to purchase a car and renew his home furniture.

loans.use: to purchase machinery needed for the blacksmith

loans.name: Bertha Margarita

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Calle América se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Bertha, tiene 51 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, todos mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun  vive en su casa, su esposo es albañil.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta y la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza a base de pedidos. Ella sale a recorrer cuatro días de la semana más que todo en las mañanas y a veces también vende en su casa, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada 8 o quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil, Ambato y Huaquillas (Perú) cuando necesita, lleva en su negocio 6 años y que le va muy bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque los créditos le son de gran ayuda.
 
Su sueño es tener un almacén o una boutique.
texts.en:
The Calle América communal bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton. The area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture. Its handicrafts are known at a national and international level. The area is known for the famous panama hats.

In this place, we meet Bertha. She is 51 years old. She is married and she has three children from this relationship. They are all older in age. One of the children still lives in her house. Her husband is a construction worker.

She sells all types of clothing. She sells door to door. The majority of her sales are based on orders. She goes out four days a week usually in the mornings. Sometimes she also sells items in her house. She offers item on credit and makes charges every week or every two weeks. She purchases her merchandise in a Guayaquil, Ambato y Huaquillas, Perú when necessary. She has had her business for six years and it is going very well.

This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise like: pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothing. She has been in this communal bank since the beginning. She likes the bank because the loans are a big help.

Her dream is to have a shop or boutique.

loans.use: purchase pants, blouses, t-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 37-year-old man from Marka, Amman, Jordan and a father of one child.

Fadi is requesting a loan of 800 JD to do home maintenance  with an aspiration of purchasing his own house someday.

loans.use: to do home maintenance.

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felista is 32 years old, married and a mother of three children. She sells used clothes and has been in the business for the last 10 years, with a monthly profit of KES 15,000.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. She is applying for her second loan of KES 40,000 from the company, which she intends to use to purchase skirts, trousers blouses and bed sheets. She will save the anticipated profit and educate her children as she also continues growing her business. 

In future, Felista hopes that her business will expand and enable her to earn more money and become financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase skirts, trousers blouses and bed sheets

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is 38 years old, married and a father of two children. He sells household items and has been in the business for the last six years, earning a monthly income of KES 35,000.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his third loan of KES. 60,000 from the company, which he intends to use to add additional stock of frying pans, lamps, plastic cups, and household plates for his business. 

The client will save the anticipated profit and help pay school fees for his children as well as continue taking care of his family. In future, Jonah hopes to grow his business and turn it into a well-stocked retail shop.

loans.use: To buy frying pans, lamps, plastic cups, and household plates.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past five years, she has owned rental houses. The tenants are her potential customers. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by tenants. Saumu dreams of establishing another rental house in the future.

With the KSHS 50,000, she wants to install electricity in her rental houses. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to install electricity in her rental houses.

loans.name: Donatila Olga Inés

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Bosques  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, conocida desde hace muchos años como la Ciudad Del Valle lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Emprendedora de los Bosques.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Donatila, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos todos mayores de edad,  con ella vive la menor de sus hijos que está soltera y estudia en  universidad. Su esposo es Ing. Sanitario.

Ella es manicurista y cosmetóloga y además se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y productos Esika (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días, ella realiza sus ventas al mismo tiempo que realiza sus trabajos faciales a sus clientas, trabaja a domicilio y también en su casa y espera muy pronto adecuar un lugar para instalar un salón de belleza. Los  productos que vende los deja a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Lo que es ropa se la traen desde Panamá o también compra en Guayaquil. Lleva más de 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien.
 
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas y cosméticos para vender y para realizar sus trabajos de belleza, también va a comprar ropa para la venta.  Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta porque los intereses son más bajos que en otras instituciones de crédito.
 
Su sueño es tener un local para sus negocios.
texts.en:
Every two weeks the members of Emprendedora de los Bosques Communal Bank meet in the citadel of the city of Portoviejo, a pretty city of green mountains and charming landscapes known for many years as the City of the Valley.

Here we met Donatila.  She is 48 years old and married, and from this relationship has three grown children.  The youngest of her children lives with her; she is single and studies in the university.  Donatila's husband is Sanitario.  She is a manicurist and cosmetologist.  She also works in business, selling clothing and Esika products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories).

She works every day.  She makes her sales at the same time she gives facials to her customers.  She works at homes and also in her own house.  She hopes that soon she will be able to adapt a place to set up her beauty salon.  She sells her products on credit and receives payment every week or two, in accordance with what her customers want.  The clothing she sells is brought from Panama; she also buys it in Guayaquil.  She has been in this business for more than eight years and it is going very well for her. 

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, and cosmetics to sell and to do her beauty work.  She also is going to buy clothing to sell.

She has been with the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because the interest is lower than in other lending institutions.  Her dream is to have a shop for her businesses.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, and clothing.

loans.name: Paula Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Calle América se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Paula, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 11, 8 y 6  años de edad, todos estudia en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.
 
Ella realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo el cual se dedica  a la venta de pescado, su esposo todos los días se desplaza hasta la ciudad de Manta lugar donde compra buen pescado y a buen precio, luego regresa a Montecristi y empieza a recorrer la ciudad en un triciclo ofreciendo sus productos, él lleva más de 18 años en este negocio y fue algo que aprendió desde pequeño ya que antes él acompañaba a su mamá en este negocio hasta que se independizó y ahora es la fuente de ingresos con el cual saca adelante a su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado. Lleva más de 12 años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho para financiarse.
 
Su sueño es tener un carro para que su marido realice sus ventas con más comodidad.
texts.en:
The American Community Bank Street meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and craftsmanship that is recognized nationally and internationally. Place of the famous straw hats.

Here we met the Ms. Paula, 31 years old, married with three children, ages 11, 8 and 6 and all in school. Her husband is a businessman.
 
She is taking the loan for her husband's business which sells fish.  Every day her husband travels to the city of Manta where he buys good fish at a good price, then back to Montecristi and begins to travel the city on tricycle offering his products.  He has been doing this business for more than 18 years and was something he learned early because before he went with his mother in this business until he became independent and now is the source of income which moves forward his family.

This loan is to buy fish. She has over 12 years in the community bank and likes it because the loans help her to finance the business.
 
Her dream is to have a car for her husband to make sales more comfortably.

loans.use: to purchase fish.

loans.name: Juana Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Juana Lucia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien es maestra de primaria desde hace 4 años. Ella esta casa y tiene dos niños uno de 12 años y la menor de 20 meses por los que trabaja arduamente.
El crédito lo utilizará para la compra de unos electrodomésticos y mejoras del hogar. Su meta es aumentarle a su casa.
texts.en:
Juana Lucia is a hardworking and diligent woman. She has been a primary school teacher for four years. She is married and has two children, one is twleve and the younger one is 20 months old. She works hard for them. 

She will use the loan to buy some household appliances and improve her home. Her goal is to expand her house.

loans.use: to buy household appliances.

loans.name: Maribel Ana

texts.es:
Maribel es una joven de 27 años, es  madre de 1 pequeño de 2 años al cual adora mucho, ella es conviviente y junto a su pareja hacen todo lo posible para sacar adelante a su retoño, Maribel vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad caracterizada por su clima cálido y también porque es una ciudad en la cual la pesca es una actividad muy importante, Maribel como buena peruana le gusta mucho nuestra comida, es así que su plato favorito es el “Arroz Con pollo”, ella solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar Ingles.

Maribel trabaja en la venta de abarrotes así como también en la venta de bebidas gaseosas y cerveza, le dedica a su negocio alrededor de 15 horas diarias ya que se levanta muy temprano para poder iniciar sus labores, puede atender hasta 25 clientes de manera diaria y ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque los brinda una atención amable.

Maribel está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al apoyo brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería y así poder tener mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, con ello podrá seguir ahorrando y así poder cumplir su más grande sueño: “Darle una buena calidad de Vida a su hijo y convertirlo en un profesional exitoso”
texts.en:
Maribel is a 27-year-old young person. She is the mother of a two year old that she adores. She lives with her partner and together they are doing everything possible to succeed in life. Maribel lives in Pisco city, a city known for its warm climate. It is also a city where fishing is very important. Maribel, being a good Peruvian, loves Peruvian food. Her favorite food is chicken with rice. Maribel has only completed the fifth grade but she would really like to study English.
Maribel sells groceries and also sodas and beer. She works at this business fifteen hours a day. She gets up very early to start her workday. She serves up to twenty-five customers a day. She believes that her business is good and she has a good clientele. 
Maribel is very appreciative of the loans from KIVA and she is thankful for the support they have provided. She will be able to buy more merchandise and therefore have a greater variety of products to offer her customers. She will continue saving and thereby obtain her greatest dream, “To give her son a good quality of life and help him be a successful professional”.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María es una mujer muy carismática tiene 33 años y es conviviente, junto a su pareja tienen 4 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 10, 7, 5, 2 años; los tres mayores actualmente estas estudiando y el motor de todos por ser muy pequeño está en casa, su pareja la apoya mucho, es su brazo derecho. Ana María como buena peruana le gusta mucho nuestra comida, pero su plato favorito es el riquísimo ceviche de Pescado, Ana María solo estudio hasta el quinto año de educación secundaria, debido a que sus padres no contaban con el dinero suficiente para poder darle una buena educación, le hubiera gustado ser Oficial de la Policía, por ello hace todo lo que puede por sacar adelante a sus hijos y que ellos sean mejores que ella.

Ana María trabaja en la venta de ropa, trabaja alrededor de 6 horas diarias y atiende hasta 10 clientes por dia, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con sus clientes y por la calidad de los productos que ofrece.

Ana María Esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que con la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar más mercadería en especial ropar de temporada de verano, lo que le permitirá que tener más variedad de productos y tener mayores ingresos para poder seguir ahorrando y poder cumplir su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a sus hijos y tener una gran tienda”.
texts.en:
Ana María is a very charismatic woman. She is 33 years old and she lives with her partner. She and her partner have four children who are ten, seven, five and two years of age. The three oldest are currently studying and the youngest is still in the house since he is still quite young. Her partner supports her a lot and is her right hand man. 

Like a good Peruvian, Ana María loves our food, but her favorite dish is the delicious fish ceviche. Ana María only studied up to the fifth year of secondary school. She would have liked to have been a police official. This is why she does everything she can to get her children ahead so that they can be better off than her. 

Ana María works in clothing sales. She works around six hours a day and attends to as many as ten customers daily. She believes that her business is going well because she is very nice to her customers in addition to the quality of the products she offers. 

Ana María is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the help they have offered she will be able to buy more merchandise, especially clothing for the summer season. This will allow her to have a bigger variety of products and make a better income so that she will be able to continue saving and achieve her greatest dream, to give her children a profession and have a bigger store.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (summer clothing).

loans.name: Milagros Xiomara

texts.es:
Milagros es una mujer trabajadora y sobre todo una madre amorosa, tiene 2 hijos cuyas edades comprenden 3 y 5 años, ambos cursan educación inicial, milagros los adora y sobre todo es por ellos que ella trabaja, porque quiere darle un buen futuro y sobre todo educación, ya que ella solo estudio hasta el quinto año de educación secundaria  debido a que sus padre no contaban con muchos recursos, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar contabilidad. Milagros como buena peruana le gusta mucho la comida, pero su platillo predilecto son los “Tallarines”.

Milagros cocina muy rico por ello se dedica a su negocio de venta de comida, se levanta desde muy temprano para poder organizarse, ella trabaja alrededor de 15 horas diarias, asimismo puede atender hasta 30 clientes por día, y es que ella cree que le va bien en su negocio por su sazón y sobre todo por el orden que hay en su negocio y la limpieza, pero sobre todo porque sus pequeños le dan el aliento para seguir dia dia, en especial porque cuando los ve sonreír se le llena de emoción el corazón y eso es lo que la mantiene con fuerzas.

Milagros esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar más utensilios e insumos para la preparación de sus platillos, así como también realizar mejoras en el local para que los clientes se sientan a gusto y pueda seguir creciendo, con ello tendrá mayores ingresos y podrá seguir ahorrando para poder cumplir  su más grande sueño:” tener su propio local” ya que actualmente trabaja en uno alquilado.
texts.en:
Milagros is a hardworking woman and a loving mother. She has two children who are three and five years old. Both are in primary school. They are miracles that she adores and above all it is for these children that she works. She hopes to give them a good future and more than anything else, a good education. She only finished school up to the fifth grade. Her parents didn’t have many resources. She would have liked to study accounting. Milagros, as a good Peruvian, likes Peruvian food. Her favorite food is “Tallarines” (noodles).
Milagros is a great cook and she sells prepared food as a business. She gets up very early in order to prepare for her customers. She works around fifteen hours a day. She has up to thirty customers each day. She believes that her business does well because of her seasonings and above all because she runs an orderly and clean business. Her children give her the will to work each day. When she sees their smiles her heart fills with emotion. This is what motivates her.
Milagros is thankful for the loan from KIVA. Thanks to this help she is able to buy utensils and goods in order to prepare her food. She sees improvements in her business, as her customers feel content. She would like to continue growing her business. With this loan she will have more earnings and she will be able to continue saving in order to reach her greatest dream, to own the location of her business, as now she is renting.

loans.use: to buy utensils and goods.

loans.name: Erasmo José

texts.es:
La venta de granos básicos es el negocio que desarrolla el joven Erasmo José en el departamento de León desde hace 5 años siendo este negocio el que le permite llevar el sustento a su familia. Se ha caracterizado por vender todo tipo de granos básicos entre los que se encuentran maíz, trigo, frijoles, arroz y otros granos.

Actualmente, el señor Erasmo José esta atravesando una dificultad y es que los granos se están agotando y la demanda ha aumentado. Por ello está solicitando un crédito para la compra de los granos básicos tales como arroz, frijoles, maíz y trigo para su respectiva comercialización tanto al detalle como al por mayor y así obtener mayores  ingresos para el bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
The young Erasmo José's business is selling staple grains in the department of León. He has had this business for the past five years which allows him to support his family. He is known for selling all kinds of basic grains, among which one can find corn, wheat, beans, rice and other grains. 

Currently, Erasmo José is experiencing some difficulty as the grains are running out and demand has increased. This is why he is requesting a loan to buy basic grains like rice, beans, corn and wheat for resale both for retail and wholesale. This way he will make a better income for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy corn, wheat, rice, and beans, etc.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
El señor Gregorio solicita un préstamo para poner el portón al frente de su vivienda ya que no tiene seguridad para su familia. 
Don Gregorio es empleado de una compañía de construcción desde siete años, con una parte del ingreso planea pagar el crédito, ya que es la fuente de ingreso de su familia. 
Desea mejorar su patrimonio y calidad de vida de sus hijos y así mejorar su futuro.
texts.en:
Gregorio requests a loan to build a gate in front of his house because there is no form of security for his family. Gregorio is employed by a construction company and has been for seven years. He plans to pay for the loan from a portion of his income, now that he is the source of income for his family.
He wishes to improve his assets and the quality of life for his children, thereby improving their future.

loans.use: to build a gate in front of his house.

loans.name: Guillermina Mercedes

texts.es:
Guillermina Mercedes se ha destacado por ser comerciante del mercado la terminal ya que realiza deliciosos platillos de comida el cual los comercializa a diario. Inicia a elaborar la comida a la 3 de la mañana y posteriormente se traslada al mercado para realizar sus ventas y finaliza a las 11 de la mañana y luego, por las tardes vende fritanga hasta las 10 de la noche.

Doña Guillermina utilizará el crédito de CEPRODEL para la compra al por mayor de los productos con los cuales elabora la comida donde obtiene mayor ganancia y así ha podido mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia. Entre los productos que comprará se encuentran arroz, frijoles, aceite, pollo, carne de res y de cerdo, gaseosas, juegos, entre otros.

Este  negocio lo inició en el mercado con un capital de C$ 500 productos de ahorros, y realiza este tipo de trabajo para la mantención de sus hijos ya que es madre soltera.

Gracias al crédito brindado por CEPRODEL podrá seguir aumentando su capital de trabajo y así obtener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia y ella.
texts.en:
Guillermina Mercedes has made herself known as a vendor at the bus terminal market. She makes delicious dishes which she sells daily. She begins cooking at three in the morning. Then she goes to the market to make her sales and finishes at eleven in the morning. In the afternoon she sells fried snacks until ten at night. 

Guillermina will use the CEPRODEL loan to buy wholesale products which she will use to make her dishes and make a better income. This way she will be able to improve her and her family's quality of life. Among the things she will buy are rice, beans, oil, chicken, beef, pork, soft drinks and cutlery. 

She started this business in the market with 500 Córdobas from savings. She does this kind of work to take care of his children as she is a single mother. 

Thanks to the loan offered by CEPRODEL she will be able to continue increasing her capital and that way have a better quality of life for her family and herself.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, beef, pork, soft drinks and cutlery, etc.

loans.name: Ofelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Ofelia del Carmen, inicia sus actividades a las 6 de la mañana en el  punto ofertando lo que es ropa así como también frutas, finaliza sus labores a las 5 de la tarde. Su puesto está ubicado en el mercado de León donde realiza esta actividad para la mantención de su hija que tanto ama.

El crédito será utilizado para la compra de productos de mayor calidad tales como: tobilleras, blúmeres, bóxer, camisetas, delantales, blusas y así poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes logrando incrementar sus ventas que le ayudaran a mejorar su calidad de vida.

Se siente agradecida porque anteriormente ha realizado créditos con Ceprodel y le han ayudado a incrementar su capital de trabajo ya que compra más barato sus productos por lo que al venderlos obtiene los ingresos que poco a poco le van permitiendo mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Mrs. Ofelia del Carmen begins work at exactly 6am selling clothes and also fruit. She finishes work at 5pm. Her stall is located in the market in Leon. She does this work in order to support her daughter that she loves so much. This loan will be used to buy good quality products such as ankle socks, underwear, boxers, shirts, aprons and blouses. In this way she will be able to increase her sales and improve her quality of life. She is thankful for the loans she has received from Ceprodel. They helped her to increase her working capital. She can buy her products at a cheaper price and sell them at a greater price. She has increased her earnings little by little and that has allowed her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy ankle socks,underwear, boxers, shirts, aprons, blouses, sheets, quilts, children's clothes, etc.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 56 years old, married and a father of four children. He is a draftsman as well as a building contractor. He has been in the business for the last twenty years earning a monthly profit of KES 50,000. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and he is applying for his first loan of KES. 100,000 from KADET LTD, which he intends to use to buy additional tools and materials for work. 

He will save the anticipated profit and continue paying school fees for his children as well as keep on looking after his family. In the future, Joseph hopes to grow his business and venture into the real estate business.

loans.use: to buy additional tools and materials

loans.name: Marina Isabel

texts.es:
Marina Isabel es propietaria de un negocio de venta de bebidas, comestibles y frutas donde realiza sus compras desde las 5 de la mañana en el mercado de León y posteriormente se traslada a su puesto de trabajo donde con mucho entusiasmo vende las bebidas, comestibles y frutas.

Actualmente está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo directamente en la compra de las frutas como bananos, naranjas, bebidas como gaseosas, jugos variados y otros. Al obtener dicho crédito logrará obtener mejores ganancias y de esta manera mejorará la calidad de vida propia y la de su familia.

La señora Marina está muy agradecida con Ceprodel ya que le ha ayudado a crecer en su negocio con frutas, bebidas y comestibles ya que le han ayudado mucho a desarrollarse debido a que antes vendía ambulantemente las frutas y ahora ya tiene su puesto propio.
texts.en:
Marina Isabel is the owner of a business selling drinks, food and fruit. She starts making her sales at five in the morning in the León market. Afterwards she goes to her stand where she sells drinks, food and fruit with much enthusiasm. 

Currently she is requesting a loan to invest directly in the purchase of fruit such as bananas and oranges, drinks like soft drinks and a variety of juices among others. Upon receiving this loan she will be able to make a better income and in this way improve her own and her family's quality of life. 

Marina is very grateful for Ceprodel as it has helped her to grow her business with fruit, drinks and food. It has helped her to develop as before she sold fruit on the street and now she has her own stand.

loans.use: to buy juices, soft drinks and fruit like bananas and oranges, as well as cookies, candy, cigarettes, etc.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 37-year-old woman from Kisumu City in Western Kenya. She and her husband John have two children who are 9 and 13 years old.

Florence operates a jewelry business in Kisumu, which she has done for the last three years. She makes a monthly income of 20000 KES. She is taking her second loan from the Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), which she will use to buy stock like necklaces, earrings and lipstick to sell. 

She will use her profits to educate and feed her family. Her dream is to have a big jewelry shop in Kisumu.

loans.use: to buy stock like necklaces, earrings and lipstick to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for selling fish and frozen products.

loans.name: Rukhshona

texts.ru: Рухшона проживает в городе Исфара. Ей 25 лет. Она не замужем. Рухшона уже шесть месяцев как занимается торговлей сухофруктов в оптом. Она в основном продает курагу. Кредит берет для закупа сухофруктов.
texts.en: Rukhshona lives in the town of Isfara. She is 25 years old. She is not married. Rukhshona has been selling dried fruits in wholesale for six months now. She mainly sells dried apricots. She is taking out the loan to buy more dry fruits.

loans.use: to buy dry fruits.

loans.name: Jahongir

texts.ru: Чахонгир проживает в городе Душанбе. Ему 30 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается развозкой пассажиров. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для приобретения автомашины.
texts.en: Jahongir lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 30 years old and married. He has two children. His wife is a homemaker. He transports passengers and has been in this business for five years. He is taking out the loan to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase a car.

loans.name: Elie

texts.en: Elie is a 43-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and only school-aged child. He strives to work under pressure to offer a good future for his child. Elie started to work very early in 1998 expecting to build a good career, and he succeeded. He’s now working as a plumber on a freelance basis, and has a fair number of clients asking for his services. He’s requesting to borrow $1300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l in order to renew his plumbing tools and equipment. He notes that he’s willing to take bigger projects and this Kiva loan will help him to achieve his goal. In the future, he plans to open his own plumbing shop.

loans.use: to renew his plumbing tools and equipment

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a married man with five children, three of whom attend school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past three years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling from home to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of delayed payments by creditors. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru: Фарход проживает в Гиссарском районе. Ему 26 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Фарход занимается торговлей. У него имеется торговая точка на рынке, где он продает продукты питания. В этой области Фарход шесть лет. Он берет кредит для покупки продуктов с целью увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Farhod lives in the Gissar district.  He is 26 years old, married, and has one child.  His wife is a homemaker.  Farhod is involved in the sale of food products and owns a retail outlet at the market. He has been living in the same area for the past six years.  He is taking a loan to buy food products and broaden his selection of goods.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy undergarments, household linens, and women's pajamas.

loans.name: Jawa

texts.en:
Jawa is a married man with one child, who is still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past five years, he has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business, operating from home to the market. His potential clients are neighbors and travelers. He faces a major challenge in the high cost of purchasing fuel. He dreams of expanding his business and purchasing another motorcycle in the future. 

With the Kshs 50,000, he wants to purchase another motorcycle for his transport business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans in order to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Rizk

texts.en:
Rizk is a 49-year-old married, Lebanese man, who lives with his wife and three school-aged children. He’s hoping to earn money and enhance his family’s way of life. 
Even with all the complications he may have faced, Rizk was brave and didn’t hesitate to open his own business. He started to work as a blacksmith and painter in 1990. He’s a reputable person and has gained a fair number of customers so far. 
Now, he’s looking to borrow $2500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy additional tools and paints for his business, in order to attract more customers and increase his profits. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and renovate his shop.

loans.use: to buy additional tools and paints for his business

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a twenty-four-year-old lady from Siaya, West Kenya. She is married to Daniel and they have a one-year-old child.

Violet operates a hotel business and has been doing this for the last three years. She makes a monthly income of KES 15,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy foodstuffs for the hotel. 

Violet will use her profits to support her family and also improve her living standards. Her dream is to own a big hotel and also venture into outside catering services.

loans.use: To buy a stock of foodstuffs for the hotel.

loans.name: Benta

texts.en:
Benta is a fifty-two-year-old lady from Siaya, in the west of Kenya. She is married to Harun and they have six children who depend on them.

Benta is a soft drink stockist in Siaya town, a business she has had for the last seven years. She makes a monthly income of KES 16,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy more stocks of soft drinks. 

She will use her profits to grow her business and also pay school fees for her children. Her dream is to venture into regional supply and distribution of soft drinks.

loans.use: To add to her stocks of soft drinks.

loans.name: Luis Heriberto

texts.es:
Luis Heriberto tiene 24 años de estado civil soltero vive con la madre y no tiene  hijos. Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama VENCEREMOS UNIDOS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto La Templanza, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

Luis Heriberto se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es tener dinero para salir de viaje a otro país.

Le gusta ver la televisión los programas de las tradiciones de otros países.
texts.en:
Luis Heriberto is 24 years old. He is single and lives with his mother. He has no children. He lives in the Ventanas canton, Los Rios province.

The communal bank is called VENCEREMOS UNIDOS [Together We Will Overcome]. It is located in the community of Anchoveta, on the road to the community of La Templanza. It belongs to the Pueblo Viejo canton. This bank is dedicated to short cycle agricultural work, corn and rice crops. 

Luis Heriberto works in agriculture, planting corn and rice. He buys his materials in Ventanas and sells his products in the market of the same place and in the Pueblo Viejo canton.

The loan he asked for is to buy fertilizer, urea and liquid fertilizer to plant corn and rice. The loan has helped him increase his income fo his family and to invest. His dream is to have the money to travel in another country.

He likes to watch television about traditions in other countries.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, urea, and liquid fertilizer.

loans.name: Karmen

texts.en:
Karmen is a 31-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children. She works together with her husband in order to offer her children a good future. 

Since 2008, she has been selling clothes from her home. She also visits customers in their homes to promote her products. As for her husband, he has been working in a local company since 2008. 

Today, Karmen wants to borrow $2000 from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added clothes in order to increase her sales thus her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own clothing shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional clothes to sell.

loans.name: Maria Beatriz

texts.es:
María Beatriz tiene 37 años de estado civil Casada vive con el esposo   y con sus hijos,  Vive en el  Cantón Ventanas provincia los Ríos.

La ventanilla se llama VENCEREMOS UNIDOS se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto La Templanza, perteneciente al cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembre de maíz y arroz.

María Beatriz se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace algunos años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y las vende en el mercado del mismo lugar y en Cantón Pueblo Viejo.

El crédito solicito para la compra de abono, urea, líquidos  fertilizantes para la siembra del maíz y arroz. El préstamo le ayudado para aumentar los ingresos para el consumo de la familia y para invertir. Su sueño es tener dinero para poder comprar un tractor para trabajar en el campo.

Le gusta limpiar la casa, cocinar para la familia que se reúnen los domingos.
texts.en:
María Beatriz is 37 years old. She is married and lives with her husband and her children. She lives in the Ventanas canton, Los Rios canton.  

The communal bank is called VENCEREMOS UNIDOS [Together We Will Overcome], located in the community of Anchoveta, on the road to the community of La Templanza, which belongs to the Pueblo Viejo canton. This bank is dedicated to short term agricultural work, such as corn and rice.

María Beatriz has worked for several years in farming, planting corn and rice. She buys her materials in Ventanas and sells her products in the market in there and in the Pueblo Viejo canton.

The loan she has asked for is to buy fertilizer, urea, and liquid fertilizer to plant corn and rice. The loan has helped her to increase her income for her family and to invest. Her dream is to be able to buy a tractor to work in the fields.

She likes to clean her house and cook for her family, who get together on Sundays.

loans.use: in order to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizers and manure

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is a thirty-five-year-old man who is married and has no children. He transports and sells vegetables in Kiambu. Samson has been in this business for ten years now and gets a monthly income of about fifteen thousand shillings.

This will be Samson’s first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to expand his vegetable business. With the profit that he will get he  wants to open a grocery in another town. In future he wants to own several vegetable outlets.

loans.use: To expand his vegetable business.

loans.name: Owadis

texts.en:
Owadis is a 32-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and one sibling. His father is doing his best to cover the family expenses and fulfill their needs. As for Owadis, he has owned a beauty salon since 2010. He’s a reputable person, known for his beautiful styling. 

Today, he’s asking to borrow $2,100 from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to replenish his beauty products and renovate his salon. In that way, his salon will be expanded and he will be able to receive more clients and therefore increase his revenues. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and better develop his work.

loans.use: to replenish his beauty products and renovate his salon.

loans.name: Mwenda

texts.en:
Mwenda is a married woman with three children. Two have graduated from school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to become a wholesaler in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Rabab

texts.en:
Rabab is a 41-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and four children, two of whom are working while the others are still attending school. Rabab and her husband are joining forces to be able to pay their children’s educational fees. Her husband is working on his own. As for her, she has owned a beauty salon since 2008. 

Today, she’s requesting to borrow $2,600 from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional beauty products and equipment for her salon. She notes that this will boost her business and allow her to attract new customers. In the future, she plans to open her own beauty center.

loans.use: to purchase additional beauty products and equipment for her salon.

loans.name: Hamadi

texts.en:
Hamadi is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expense is hospital bills.

For the past one year, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of theft in his place of operation. Hamadi dreams of expanding to become a wholesale supplier in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. Mwanakombo dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase sacks of sugar and rice and bundles of wheat flour and maize flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of sugar and rice and bundles of wheat flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with two children, one boy and one girl, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past eight years, she has operated a food stall business, selling to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bales of maize floor, wheat flour and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of maize flour, wheat flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman with three boys and five girls. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past seven years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She also faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. Salome dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of beans, sugar, maize flour and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, sugar, maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is taking out another bigger loan of KES 80,000 to improve her business. With the loan, she wants to purchase another refrigerator for storing fish for sale. She dreams of expanding and establishing another shop selling fish in the future to earn more profit.

loans.use: To purchase another refrigerator for storing  fish for her business.

loans.name: Divinité Plus Group

texts.en:
Divinité Plus is a Community Bank made up of 33 members whose chairman is Lubadika. These members are united for the same goal: to grow their businesses using loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. 

Lubadika sells cans of paints. He began his business in 1998. After hard work and good management, he succeeded in making it thrive thanks to the accumulated profits. He will increase his stock of merchandise with his next loan by buying some more cans of paints in bulk and reselling them at a profit in his neighborhood. Every week his business generates a profit of US$40. Lubadika is 32 years old and engaged.

loans.use: to increase his stock of merchandise by purchasing some cans of paints in bulk and reselling them at a profit.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle has been an artist her entire life.  She studied art at the University of New Orleans and New Orleans Academy of Fine Arts.  She has done set dressing for major motion pictures, has been a stylist for Mattel Toys, has done music video styling and has been a scenic artist for all of New Orleans local theaters.   

In 2008, Michelle started Mondo Murals & Design, LLC.  She's been painting specialty murals in businesses and private homes.  She also has many fine art paintings for sale in several galleries in the French Quarter of New Orleans.  Michelle is now branching out and printing her art on home decor and gift ware items. With her Kiva loan, Michelle will be able to reproduce her art on mugs, aprons, matted prints, coasters, trivets and other items.  To view some of Michelle's work go to www.mondomurals.com.

On Mardi Gras day, Michelle can be found winding her way from Uptown to the French Quarter with "Mondo Kayo Social & Marching Club," a New Orleans salute to Carnival across the tropics. Revelers in colorful handmade costumes dance to Caribbean, Latin and African beats blaring from tiki floats. Michelle enjoys Mondo Kayo so much that she named her business Mondo Murals & Design after it.  Mondo means "world," and Michelle's goal is to paint her murals all over the world.

loans.use: to purchase aprons, coasters, trivets, bowls, mugs, matted prints and other home decor and gift items on which to print her art.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Tim is a New Orleans police lieutenant about to retire from the force after 31 years. 

Six months ago, he bought a travel agency franchise to keep himself busy during retirement. He says, "I always wanted to do something that makes people happy and people are always happy when they go on vacation."  

Tim is a "destination specialist." He arranges tours to Africa, China and the Holy Land. He also specializes in cruises. Tim has been on almost all of the major cruise lines and considers himself an expert on the demographics of the clientele on each of the lines. He's traveled to Bermuda, the Bahamas and Alaska.  

When asked how he can compete with the online travel services, Tim says that he beats their prices because the online companies charge an additional fee that Tim does not charge.  

He heard about Kiva on the radio in New Orleans. Coincidentally, he plans to use his loan proceeds to advertise his business on the radio and also to buy ads on the street cars in New Orleans. Help Tim launch his new business to make people happy.

loans.use: to pay for radio advertisements and street car advertisements.

loans.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia is one of Esperanza Internacional's entrepreneurs. She has been taking loans with Esperanza Internacional since three years ago, when she started her gasoline sales, in front of her house, on one of the main routes in the city of Samana. 

She is one of the members in the group called Trabajando para el Mañana (Working for the Future) located in one of the rural villages in the city of Samana. She has invested her fifth loan in her business selling gasoline and other fuels. 

Now she is receiving her sixth loan to improve her housing, having shown herself to be a dedicated woman, paying well all her previous loans and expanding her business. 

Esperanza Internacional is running a program where most of their good clients -- those who have fulfilled the commitment to grow their businesses and have shown fidelity in their groups -- can take loans to improve their house structure, while running their businesses loans and attending to their group meetings. 

She is the mother of three children and she lives together with her long-term partner in a simple home structure. They are working hard to change their home structure, and they decided to take a loan in Esperanza to start improving her house. With this loan they will buy zinc, two windows and a door. They will change some of the damaged zinc in the roof and will have the windows and door they need for the front of the house. 

Denia thanks all of you for your support!

loans.use: to buy zinc, two windows and a door.

loans.name: Jivy

texts.en:
Jivy is married and has five children. Jivy is 46 years old and lives in Taguitic, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte, Philippines.

Jivy provides transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She has been doing this for 11 years and every month she earns 10,000 PHP from this work. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to repair her vehicle and purchase spare parts and accessories for better service.

Jivy has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Jivy hopes to finish the study of her children and to have a pump boat.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle and purchase spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is married and has four children. He is 37 years old and lives in Esperanza, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Edwin raises pigs for sale to earn a living. He has been in his business for eight years and he earns 16,312 PHP. 

He has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Edwin has been a member of GDMPC for one year. He is hoping to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

location.town: ESPERANZA, RAMON MAGSAYSAY, ZAMBOANA DEL SUR

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina is from San Jose, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 49 years old. Justina is separated and has two adult children. 

To make a living, Justina owns and operates a specialized retail business, selling clothes and other supplies to the local community. Justina has been in her business for 21 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2007, Justina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Justina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to used the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is 44 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is married and has five children. 

Sheila used her last loan to buy additional products to sell such as grocery items, school and office supplies, etc. Her business has grown and become successful. 

Now, she is taking a new loan to purchase new items to expand her product offering. She is optimistic that she will be able to grow her business more.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Deyanira

texts.es: Deyanira es madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 11 a 17 años, y con ellos sueña,  mediante su trabajo, lograr que gocen de  un futuro exitoso;  ella vive al sur de la ciudad y en condiciones de mujer jefe de hogar, por lo cual sus actividades se extienden  continuamente.  Deyanira se dedica a la venta de alimentos diariamente; en la mañana prepara desayunos, al medio día almuerzos y en la tarde se dedica a ordenar el negocio y a las  actividades propias de su hogar.   Su negocio está ubicado en un local  en la vivienda donde habita, en condiciones de arrendataria, pues la casa pertenece a un familiar que vive en otra ciudad. Inicialmente Su microempresa hace 17 años estaba, en una esquina del barrio muy cerca al parque, donde se dedicaba a vender sopa;  al terminar con estas, vendía frutas, jugos naturales y chichas; así fue como gradualmente formó su propia clientela y se trasladó a la casa donde hoy vive y su negocio ha estado funcionando  durante esta última temporada; allí le ha ido muy bien en sus ventas y sueña con hacerlo crecer aun mas. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará  en mayor volumen, víveres, como aceite, arroz, granos, azúcar, sal entre otros, en mayores cantidades. Con esta compra de contado y en mayor volumen logrará descuentos que trasladaría a sus productos para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes de comprar a un precio razonable.
texts.en:
Deyanira is the mother of three children from the ages of 11 to 17.  She dreams that through her work they will manage to enjoy a successful future.  She lives to the south of the city, and she is the head of the household.  Therefore, her business activities go on continually.

Deyanira sells food every day.  She makes breakfasts in the morning, lunches at noon, and in the evening she devotes herself to organizing the business and taking care of her household.  Her business is located in a place in her home, which is rented.  The house belongs to a relative who lives in another city.

When she started 17 years ago her business was on a neighborhood corner very close to the park.  That is where she sold soup.  When she stopped selling soup she sold fruit, natural juices, and “chichas” (a corn based drink).  That is how she gradually got her own customers.  She moved to the house where she lives, and it has been working throughout this last season.  Her sales have been going very well for her there, and she dreams of having it grow even more.

She is now applying for a Kiva loan, her first with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy supplies like oil, rice, sugar, and salt in greater quantities.  With this cash purchase in greater volume she will get discounts.  This will translate to meeting her customers’ needs of buying her products at a reasonable price.

loans.use: to buy supplies like oil, rice, sugar, and salt in greater quantities.

loans.name: G.s 12 De Enero Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario 12 de Enero está conformado por 2 emprendedoras que sean unido para salir adelante y apoyarse, ellas son de la misma localidad donde habitan cada una tiene su negocios lo cual uno de los sueños de ambas es ver su negocio bien surtido. Maritza del Socorro es una de las miembro de este grupo lo cual está solicitando financiamiento para surtir su negocio de productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes, ella comprara variedad de producto para la pulpería.
texts.en:
The 12 de Enero (12th of January) communal bank is comprised of two entrepreneurs who are united in order to get ahead and support each other.  They live in the same area, and each has a business.  One of the dreams that both of them have is to see their businesses well-stocked.

Maritza del Socorro is one of the members of this group.  She is requesting this loan to stock her business with products to offer her customers.  She will buy a variety of products for her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Rutchel

texts.en:
Rutchel is 29 years old, married, and has one child who attends school.  She runs a sari-sari (general) store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for four years.  She sells a variety of items such as sugar, bread, milk, and spices. 

Rutchel is request a loan for 13,000 PHP through NWTF, which she will use to buy items such as shampoo and  groceries for her sari-sari store.  In the future, she would like to save enough to expand her business. Rutchel works very hard to provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El comité “Kuña Guapa” se encuentra en el décimo séptimo ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, cuenta con 15 integrantes, de la zona de Asunción. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que se esfuerzan por dar a sus hijos y familiares todo lo mejor.
Gladys es una de estas mujeres, ella se dedica a la venta de zapatillas bordadas y comenta que le va muy bien, pues estas están muy de moda últimamente y son muy vendidas. Gracias a que tiene muy buenas obras ya pudo formarse una buena clientela, lo cual le es de mucha ayuda.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de zapatillas, perlas, lentejuelas, hilos para bordar las zapatillas. Ella agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la ayuda que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The Kuña Guapa communal bank is in its 17th cycle in the Program for Enterprising Women with the Fundación Paraguaya.  They have 15 members, and they are from the Asunción zone.  They are very hard-working and tenacious women who put forth great effort to give their children and families all of the best.

Gladys is one of these women.  She sells embroidered slippers.  She says that it is going very well for her.  These are very much in fashion lately, and they are sold a lot.  Thanks to having good work she was able to form good clientele.  This is very helpful.

She is requesting the loan to buy slippers, pearls, sequins, and thread to embroider the slippers.  

She is grateful to the Fundación and to Kiva for the help they are receiving.

loans.use: to buy slippers, pearls, sequins, thread, and other supplies.

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhem is a responsible mother who always takes care of her children and manages all aspects of her household in addition to working in her rice fields. She is now 48 years old and lives with her four single children. She has two other children who live with their new families. 

One of Chhem's sons is going to get married in the coming month. Therefore, Chhem has applied for a loan from Kiva, through HKL to supplement her existing capital to prepare for her son's forthcoming wedding party. She hopes that our lenders won’t reject her first loan.

loans.use: to prepare her son's forthcoming wedding party.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a married man with one child who attends school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, he has operated a coconut selling business, selling from home to his neighbours and passersby. He faces a major challenge of lack of enough customers to buy coconuts. 

He dreams of expanding his business to meet his customer demand. With the KES 20,000, he wants to establish a new business of selling vegetables, and would like to purchase sacks of vegetables and tomatoes. He decided to join Yehu to access funds.

loans.use: to establish a new business of selling vegetables; to purchase sacks of vegetables and tomatoes.

loans.name: Jecel

texts.en:
Jecel is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Jecel has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Jecel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jecel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Evelyn has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Evelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Yexy Dubali

texts.es:
Yexy es una mujer trabajadora y sobre todo una madre amorosa, tiene 2 hijos cuyas edades comprenden entre  3 y 1 año, el mayor ya va a la escuela y el menor aun esta a su cuidado , Yexy  es muy cariñosa y sobre todo tiene  mucha paciencia con ellos y sobre todo es por ellos que ella trabaja, porque quiere darle un buen futuro y sobre todo brindarle una buena educación, ya que ella solo estudio hasta el quinto año de educación secundaria  debido a que sus padre no contaban con los medios económicos suficientes, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar cosmetología.  

Yexy se dedica a su negocio de venta de ropa se levanta desde muy temprano para poder organizarse, ella trabaja alrededor de 10 horas diarias, asimismo puede atender hasta 12clientes por día, ya que ella va ofreciendo sus productos de casa en casa, en especial a las mamas que viven por su barrio y es que ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy carismática y sobre todo porque le gusta tratar bien a sus clientes

Yexy esta muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar mas mercadería para su negocio, en especial ropa para la temporada de verano, con ello tendrá mayores ingresos y podrá seguir ahorrando para poder cumplir  su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena calidad de vida y una educación adecuada a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Yexy is a hardworking woman and above all a loving mother.  She has two children between the ages of 1 and 3.  The oldest already goes to school and the youngest is in her care.  Yexy is very affectionate and patient with them because she works on their behalf, because she wants to give them a good future and a good education.  She only reached the fifth year of secondary school because her parents did not have sufficient economic means, but she very much would have enjoyed studying cosmetology.

Yexy works selling clothing.  She gets up very early to be able to get organized and works around ten hours a day.  She is able to serve up to 12 customers a day because she offers her products door-to-door, especially to mothers who live in her neighborhood.  She believes that her business is going well for her because she is very charismatic and above all because she likes to treat her customers well.

Yexy is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she will be able to buy more merchandise for her business, especially summer clothing.  With this she will have higher income and be able to continue saving to be able to realize her biggest dream, "to give a good quality of life and a suitable education to her children."

loans.use: to buy more merchandise.

loans.name: Carmen Yovana

texts.es:
Carmen es una mujer creativa, vive en la ciudad de Camaná, la cual se caracteriza por su clima cálido, por su hermosas playas y porque es una de las ciudades con mucha  producción de Arroz, Carmen como buena peruana le gusta nuestra comida, en especial el riquísimo “Ceviche”, Carmen disfruta mucho de pasar su tiempo libre por las playas de su ciudad, es que el paisaje y el sonido del mar pueden relajar y hacer que uno se olvide de los problemas.

Carmen actualmente trabaja en su negocio el cual es un Salón de Belleza, en el realiza todo lo concerniente a cortes de cabello, le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 9 horas diarias y puede atender a 15 clientes de manera diaria, ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy creativa cuando realiza un corte de cabello y sobre todo porque siempre mantiene limpio su local.

Carmen agradece mucho a los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar nuevos utensilios de trabajo como tijeras, maquinas de corte de cabello, planchas entre otros, con ello dará un mejor servicios con las herramientas adecuadas y tendrá mayores ingresos lo que le permitirá seguir ahorrando para poder cumplir su gran sueño:” Tener un Salón de Belleza mas grande”.
texts.en:
Carmen is a creative woman.  She lives in the city of Camaná, which is known for its warm climate, its beautiful beaches, and for its rice production. Carmen, as a good Peruvian, likes Peruvian food.  She especially likes the delicious “Ceviche”.  Carmen enjoys spending her free time at the city beaches.  The scenery and the sound of the ocean can relax you and make you forget your problems.

Carmen currently works in her business, a beauty salon.  She does everything related to cutting hair.  She spends around nine hours a day working.  She can take care of 15 customers a day.  She believes that it is going very well for her in her business because she is very creative when she cuts hair.  Also, and most importantly, she always keeps her place clean.

Carmen is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to your help she will be able to buy more work utensils like scissors, clippers, and irons among others.  She will give better service with the adequate tools.  She will have greater income, which will allow her to be able to fulfill her biggest dream:  To have a bigger Beauty Salon.

loans.use: to buy more work utensils like scissors, clippers, and irons among others.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Merly has a shop that sells clothing such as t-shirts and blouses. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

Merly has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Merly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.

Suzette has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Suzette has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Suzette hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Remedios is providing motorcycle services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for fifteen years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

Remedios has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has eight children. 

Emily has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for fifteen years. She requested a loan for PHP 13,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Emily has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Emily hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed and has seven children.
 
Edith has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for twenty years. She requested a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Edith has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 57 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Julieta has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 20 years. She requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Julieta has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Julieta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Norielyn

texts.en:
Norielyn is 34 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in the Philippines. Norielyn has a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. 

Norielyn is requesting a loan for 13,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Norielyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Linda has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Linda has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en:
Bat-Erdene, 29, is a fruit seller in the food market which is located in the suburban district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He sells several kinds of fruits such as apples, bananas, kiwis, and grapes. He occasionally supplies some restaurants around the city. His customers always say that Bat-Erdene always sells safe and delicious fruits and they are always happy to buy from him. 

Bat-Erdene wants to increase his working capital in order to expand his business and raise his earnings. The Lunar Year is approaching, which is a traditional and respectful Mongolian celebration. The demand for groceries such as fruits will increase notably during these days. Therefore, he wants to prepare his groceries in advance of the celebration, which is a big opportunity for merchants. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchasing fruits in large amounts in order to increase his sales volume.

loans.use: to purchase fruits in large amounts to increase his sales volume.

loans.name: Batsaikhan

texts.en: Currently, the building phase of Batsaikhan's new house is about 70% complete. Now he needs a loan to purchase some more building materials, such as vacuum-insulated windows, wallpaper, and other interior decoration materials. He also wants to install a furnace for an electric heating system in his new house so the house will have smokeless heating. He thinks that smokeless heating is a good way to reduce air pollution all over. Air pollution is one of the biggest and most critical issues in Mongolia, and everyone wants to eliminate it. Furthermore, Batsaikhan has been talking about it to his friends and neighbors. The loan he is taking out will be dedicated to purchasing the necessary building materials to complete his new house and to purchasing an electric heating furnace for smokeless heating.

loans.use: To purchase the necessary building materials to complete his new house and to purchase an electric furnace for smokeless heating.

loans.name: Bebina

texts.en:
Bebina is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. 

Bebina has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Bebina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Vernice

texts.en:
Vernice is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Vernice has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Vernice has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 55 years old, married, and has seven children. She lives in the Philippines. Flordeliza has a retail shop where she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. 

Flordeliza is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Flordeliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 34 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in the Philippines.  Julius operates a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members. He has been doing this for two years and earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

Julius is requesting a loan for 10,000 PHP, which he will use to repair his vehicle for better service. In 2010, he joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. In the future, Julius hopes his children finish their studies and he gains double income from his business.

loans.use: to repair vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Saydakhon

texts.ru: Сайдахон проживает в районе Рудаки. Ей 38 лет. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж находится в Российской Федерации, а дети учатся в средней школе. Сама она занимается выращиванием овощей. В основном она выращивает капусту. Этим видом деятельности она занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян.
texts.en: Saydakhon lives in the Rudaki district.  She is 38 years old and has four children.  Her husband is in the Russian Federation, and children attend a secondary school.
