This will be her tenth loan with MFP, so she hopes for your help in continuing with her goals. She promises to be punctual with the payment of her quotas. She also says that she is comfortable with her communal bank, “Los Pioneros de Cumutay”, because of their teamwork. She will invest this loan in the purchase of 5 bags of pea seeds. With what is left over, she will pay the day labourers whom she will hire for the planting.

loans.use: to buy five bags of pea seeds and to hire day labourers.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon has operated his retail shop in Nakuru town for the last three years. He is 39 years old and married to Esther. They have three school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing client and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy more goods such as salt, tea leaves, and washing detergents to sell in his retail shop.

In the future, Gideon hopes to grow his retail shop into wholesale and get more income, thus he will be able to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: To add more stock of salt, tea leaves, and washing detergents to sell.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Rufina has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for a year. She requested a loan for PHP 16,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Rufina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rufina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Zosima has a shop that sells vegetables like squash, eggplant, and string-beans. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 15,000 to buy vegetables to sell.

Zosima has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Zosima hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is applying for another loan to start a poultry-selling business. She will use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase chicks and chicken feed for her new business. In the future, Christine aspires to continue improving her businesses. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Christine has greatly improved her family's standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase chicks and chicken feed for her new business.

loans.name: Khary

texts.fr: Madame Khary  vit au Sénégal. Elle est âgée  de 52 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère de 2 enfants de 28 et 30 ans. Elle évolue depuis plus de 10 ans dans la vente  d’habits et de chaussures. Elle a choisi l’activité de commerce par passion  mais aussi dans le but de faire face a ses besoins sociaux. C’est  la recherche de profits qui l’intéresse  le plus dans son activité. Elle est membre du guichet de  l’U-IMCEC de la localité de sa zone d’habitation depuis avril 2009. Elle sollicite un prêt de 100 000 frs prévu  pour s’approvisionner  en chaussures et habits qu’elle compte revendre a ses clients. Son objectif est d’accroitre ses bénéfices et améliorer la situation sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madame Khary  lives in Senegal. She is 52 years old, divorced and the mother of two children aged 28 and 30. 

For the last 10 years she has been selling clothes and shoes. She chose this business as she enjoys it but also with the goal of meeting her social needs. She is most interested in making profit. Since April 2009, she has been a member of her local branch of U-IMCEC.

Madame Khary is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to stock up on shoes and clothes that she will re-sell to her customers. Her goal is to increase her profits and improve her family's social situation.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to re-sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas 4 Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Unidas 4 es el grupo que se ha formado con 10 mujeres de la ciudad Encarnación. Ellas son mujeres jefas de hogar que se unieron con la esperanza de poder ayudarse las unas a las unas por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Su meta es poder hacer crecer sus micro emprendimientos y de esa forma ayudar a sus familias.
Juana es una mujer muy creativa y trabajadora, comenta que tiene muy buena pasta para la venta, y es por eso que le va muy bien. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, como ser remeras, shorts, pantalones y demás, con lo cual puede solventar su día a día y ayudar a sus familiares.remeras, shorts, pantalones y demás
Ella solicita el crédito para poder seguir creciendo, y ayudando a su familia. Desea poder comprar remeras, shorts, pantalones y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener más variedad de prendas.
texts.en:
Mujeres Unidas 4 (United Women 4) is a group com posed of 10 women form the town of Encarnación. They are housewives who decided to come together hoping to be able to help each other through their combined efforts. Their goals are to see their micro activities grow and to help their families through this mean.
Juana is a very creative and hardworking woman. She says she is very good at being a retailer and that things are going well. She engages in selling every kind of clothes such as T-shirts, shorts and trousers among others. Thanks to this activity she can provide for her daily necessities and help her family.
She is requesting a loan to keep on growing and on helping her family. She wants to buy T-shirts, shorts and trousers with which to stock up her store and offer a wider variety of clothes.

loans.use: To buy T-shirts, shorts and trousers.

loans.name: Mujeres Group

texts.es:
Mujeres es el grupo integrado por 15 señoras de la ciudad de San Lorenzo. Ellas son personas muy trabajadoras luchadoras. El grupo se formó con las integrantes de un comité antiguo que decidieron volver a unirse para que por medio del esfuerzo en conjunto puedan ayudarse las unas a las otras.
Leticia es miembro de este grupo, ella comenta que siempre ha trabajado y gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido ayudar a su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de variadas clases, el cual es su principal medio de generar dinero. Sueña con poder abrir una tienda donde pueda ofrecer una mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
Acude a la fundación y a kiva para la compra de prendas, como ser shorts, remeras, camisillas, blusas para damas y demás tipos de prendas, con lo cual podrá tener una mayor variedad. Agradecen por la oportunidad recibida.
texts.en:
Mujeres (Women) is a group composed of 15 women from the town of San Lorenzo. They are very hardworking and tenacious women. The group has been formed by the members of an old committee who decided to come back together to help each through their common efforts.
Leticia is a member of this group. She says she has always been working and thanks to her efforts she has been able to help her family. She engages in selling clothes of different kinds, and this is her main source of income. She dreams of opening a shop where to offer better comfort to her customers.
She has asked for a loan to the Foundación and to Kiva in order to buy clothes such as shorts, T-shirts, vests, blouses for women and other items of clothing in order to offer a wider variety of products. She is thankful for the opportunity she has been given.

loans.use: To buy short, T-shirts, vests and blouses for women.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Genalyn has a electronics repair shop that provides the repair of television, components, and other electrical appliances. Her husband is the master repairman. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 to buy tools and pay for the electricity for the services.

Genalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Genalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the electricity for services

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Wilfreda is 46 years old and has three children who are in school.

Wilfreda has a jewelry-selling business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more jewelry to sell.

Wilfreda has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Guaraní Group

texts.es:
Guaraní es el grupo de mujeres que son de la ciudad de Santaní. Ellas son personas que muy sacrificadas y trabajadoras, su principal objetivo es poder ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo que ellas hacen. Escucharon hablar acerca del programa de mujeres emprendedoras y quedaron encantadas con los beneficios que tienen. Ellas hacen actividades individuales y también trabajos en grupo para fomentar su compañerismo.
Constancia nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de verduras, y nos dice que tiene muy buena clientela, ya que las verduras son vendidas porque son indispensables para las comidas diarias. Ella comenta que por medio de este trabajo ayuda con los gastos diarios de su casa y así hace todo más llevadero.
Ella pide la ayuda de la fundación y de kiva para la compra de cebollas, tomates, locotes, pepinos, repollos y demás verduras, con lo cual podrá tener más productos para vender.
texts.en:
Guaraní is a group of hardworking and sacrificing women from Santaní whose main objective is to help their families through the work that they do.  They heard about the program for women entreprenuers and were delighted with the benefits available.  They work on their own and also work as a group to encourage their companionship.

Constancia tells us that she sells vegetables and that she has a good customer base since her vegetables are indispensable for everyday meals.  She says that through this work she helps with the daily expenses of her house so things are more bearable.  She is asking for help from the Foundation and from Kiva to buy onions, tomatoes, peppers, cucumbers, cabbage and other vegetables so that she will have more products to sell.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell later

loans.name: Aem

texts.en:
Aem, 36, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. Two of her children are construction workers. She and her husband have been involved in growing rice for over 10 years and are successful in their career. 

Additionally, her husband has been running a business of buying cashew nuts to resell to generate more income to support the family. In order to improve her husband's business as well as her family's living condition, Aem is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to carry the cashew nuts to sell at the market. 

In the future, she hopes to rebuild her house to make it much stronger and to provide a better living condition for her family. Moreover, she would like to support her children to study until they get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to carry cashew nuts to sell at the market

loans.name: Gladies

texts.en:
Gladies is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 
Gladies is providing a transport service using a motorcycle with a side car, with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for gasoline for the services.
Gladies has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gladies hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline for her transport services

loans.name: Diadou

texts.fr: Madame Diadou vit au Sénégal. Elle est mariée  et mère de 4 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 13 et 24 ans. Elle s’active dans le commerce et la vente d’ustensiles de cuisine depuis  plus d’une dizaine d’années. Elle a choisi son activité par recommandation de sa sœur qui exerce  la meme activité. Elle est membre du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou elle habite depuis mai 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de d’ustensiles (poêles, fourneaux, cuillère, calebasses en fer). Son intention est de renforcer  son stock de marchandises et d’accroitre ses bénéfices en vue d’améliorer la situation sociale de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madame Diadou lives in Senegal. She is married and the mother of 4 children aged between 13 and 24. For around ten years she has been involved in selling kitchen utensils. She chose this business upon the recommendation of her sister, who sells the same items. 

She has been a member of the local  UIMCEC branch since May 2011. Madame Diadou is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to buy utensils (pans, ovens, spoons, iron calabashes). She plans to increase her inventory and her profits so that she can improve her family's social situation.

loans.use: to buy utensils to re-sell.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Luz tiene 31 años y convive con Aquiles. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Lucila de 13 y Talía de 7 años de edad. Ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay, distrito de Huasahuasi. Ella se dedica a la agricultura. Por ello  trabaja en sus cultivos de papa, arveja y maíz; asimismo cría animales como vacas y toros. De las vacas saca una buena cantidad de leche para la elaboración de quesos, los que vende en la ciudad de Huasahuasi, obteniendo buenas ganancias. Ya tiene más de 20 años dedicándose a la agricultura y ganadería. Y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poner en práctica lo que sus padres le enseñaron. Luz negocia sus productos en el mercado mayorista de Tarma y de Huancayo, para esto invierte en el traslado de los sacos de papas. El trabajo del campo es cansado, por eso contrata personal operario para agilizar las faenas, por su parte, ella se encarga de preparar los alimentos para su Aquiles, su pareja, y para los jornaleros. Esa es su rutina agraria, pero le gusta lo que hace, por eso continuará con su labor por mucho tiempo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Pioneros de Cumutay” y éste sería su crédito número seis con MFP, donde espera el apoyo de todos ustedes para lograr sus planes. Además se compromete a pagar de manera puntual sus cuotas. Invertirá el dinero del préstamo en la compra de 5 bolsas de semillas de arvejas de 500 soles cada una, para iniciar una siembra. Lo restante lo destinará para el pago de los operarios a quienes contratará.
texts.en:
Luz is 31, and lives with her partner Aquiles. They have two children: Lucila is 13, and Talia is 7. They live in their own house, located in the settlement of Cumutay, in Huasahuasi district. She is a farmer,and grows potatoes, peas, and corn. She also raises animals such as cows and bulls. 

From the cows she gets a good quantity of milk for making cheeses. She sells the cheese in the city of Huasihuasi, and gets good earnings. She has been farming and raising livestock for more than 20 years now. What she likes best about her work is putting into practice what her parents taught her. Luz sells her products in the wholesale markets in Tarma and Huancayo, and to do this she pays for transporting the sacks of potatoes.

Farmwork is tiring, and that's why she hires hands to speed up the job.  She is the one who takes on the job of preparing the food for her partner Aquiles, and for the day laborers. That is the routine of farming, but she likes what she does, and that is why she will keep working for a long time.

She belongs to the "Pioneros de Cumutay" communal bank, and this would be her sixth loan with MFP, so she is hoping for support from all of you, to succeed with her plans. In addition, she promises to make her installment payments on time. 

She will use the money to buy five bags of pea seeds, at 500 soles each, to begin planting. She will allocate the remainder for paying the laborers that she will hire.

loans.use: To buy bags of pea seeds and hire day laborers.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Paloma, tiene 65 años, tiene una bodega en su casa, todos sus hijos están casados, ahora ella esta pasado por una etapa muy difícil a raíz de la muerte de su esposo que falleció el 24 de diciembre. Todas las cosas que pudo aprender en Finca, y las reuniones que tiene, le ayudan a poder estar bien, en esta etapa que le esta tocado vivir, ella agradece los préstamos recibidos porque le ayudan en todo sentido, en las capacitaciones aprendió como ahorrar, como hacer negocio, a criar a sus hijos. El préstamo que solicita ahora lo invertirá en la compra de debidas.
texts.en: Rosa is a member of the "Paloma" ("Dove") communal bank. She is 65 years old and runs a grocery store from her home. All of her children are married. She is currently going through a very difficult time due to the death of her husband, who passed away on December 24th. Everything she learned at FINCA and the meetings she attends help her stay well during this stage of her life. She gives thanks for the loans she received, because they help her in every way. In the training courses she has learned how to make savings, how to do business and how to raise her children. The loan she requests now will be used for purchasing beverages.

loans.use: to purchase beverages for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make fisherman's repairs.

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es:
Rayda de 44 años de edad convive con Mauro, con quien tiene 4 hijos, pero solo vive con el menor de ellos de 16 años, en su casa propia en el caserío de Cumutay, distrito de huasahuasi. Rayda es una mujer agricultora desde su juventud, es por eso que aprendió muy bine como trabajar la tierra. De esa manera cuenta con 3 chacras de arvejas y 2 de maíz. Afirma que, las arvejas son las que le dan mayores ingresos económicos. Toda su producción la traslada al mercado mayorista de Tarma, donde la vende con inmediatez. Compradores de la ciudad de Lima y Huancayo, se concentran en el mercado para llevarse las cosechas en camiones.
Ella esta satisfecha con sus resultados pero afirma que necesita algún apoyo para obtener financiamiento. Está contenta con el trabajo realizado con MFP. Éste sería su crédito número 10 con MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Además afirma sentirse cómoda con su banco comunal “Los Pioneros de Cumutay”.
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de una bolsa de semillas de arvejas, con las que iniciará una siembra.
texts.en:
Rayda is 44 years old and is in a partnership with Mauro, with whom she has 4 children, however she only lives with the youngest of her children who is 16 years old. She lives in her own house in the small village of Cumutay located in the district of Huasahuasi. 

Ryada has been doing agricultural work since her youth and that is why she learned how to work the land very well. In this way she has three fields of peas and two of corn. She states that the peas make the most profit. She takes all of her produce to the wholesale market in Tarma where she sells it very quickly. Buyers from the cities of Lima and Huancayo gather at the market to transport the harvest in trucks. 

She is satisfied with her results but she says that she needs some support in acquiring financing. She is happy with the work she has done with MFP. This is her tenth loan with MFP and as such she is committed to being punctual in making her payments. Additionally she says that she feels comfortable with her communal bank, Los Pioneros de Cumutay.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of a bag of pea seeds which she will use to begin planting.

loans.use: to buy a bag of pea seeds.

loans.name: Rosilda

texts.es:
Rolsida, una mujer de 25 años tiene una hija, ella cuida sola de su pequeña debido a que lamentablemente es madre soltera. Para que Rosilda y su pequeña puedan salir adelante y no tener carencias, ella se dedica a la venta de verduras y tubérculos en un mercado de la ciudad de Chincha, lugar en donde vende diariamente y pone todo su empeño para poder atender bien a sus clientes y estos le compren a diario en su puestito.

Rosilda está muy contenta de haber creado este negocio, el cual se encuentra inaugurado desde hace 1 año y ha ido mejorando con el transcurso del tiempo, ganancias que le han permitido continuar en el juego comercial.
Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, Rosilda podrá comprar muchas más verduras para su pequeño negocio, con esfuerzo, dedicación y buen ánimo ella podrá ahorrar y cumplir su gran sueño “Crecer en su negocio y ser una muy buena microempresaria”.
texts.en:
Rosilda, a woman of 25 years, has one daughter. Unfortunately she is a single mother, so she is raising her daughter alone. Rosilda sells vegetables and tubers in a market in the city of Chinca. This way she and her little one can get ahead in life and not lack anything. Rosilda works in the market daily and puts all her effort into assisting her customers well, and they buy from her stall every day. 

Rosilda is very happy to have established this business, which was started one year ago and has been improving over time. The profits have allowed her to continue in the commercial market. 

With help from Kiva lenders, Rosilda will be able to buy many more vegetables for her small business. With effort, determination and a good spirit she will be able to save and reach her big dream: "to grow her business and be a very good small businesswoman."

loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Doris Eugenia

texts.es:
Doris es una persona que ha tenido que sufrir muchas adversidades en su vida.
El padre de su hijo la abandonó, por lo que quedó como una madre soltera cabeza de familia a cargo de su hijo de 17 años. 
Doris ha trabajado fuertemente durante gran parte de su vida con el ánimo de sacar adelante a su hijo y poder brindarle todo lo que necesita. 
Doris se ha venido desempeñando en oficios domésticos en diferentes casas de familia, pero los ingresos son muy bajos por lo que tuvo que recurrir a una fuente de ingresos. Es por esto que desde hace 1 año aproximadamente viene vendiendo mercancía por catálogo a sus familiares y amigos, y de esta manera puede obtener unos ingresos superiores para poder sostener los gastos de su hogar.
Doris ha tenido últimamente muy buenas ventas, por lo que ahora tiene unos pedidos que debe entregar y por tanto debe comprar la mercancía, sin embargo, en el momento no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la compra de esta mercancía, por lo que aspira a que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a comprar mercancía de uso personal como lo es ropa interior, blusas para dama, entre otros productos que vende por catálogo.
Doris espera que con poderle cumplir a sus clientes sus ingresos se aumenten considerablemente, y así podrá ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.
Doris tiene un gran sueño y es el de tener un negocio bien grande, en el cual pueda venderle a muchos clientes y poder obtener ingresos superiores a los actuales. Además, sueña con que su hijo pueda acceder a una educación universitaria y así pueda estar preparado para un empleo bien remunerado.
texts.en: Doris is a person who has suffered many hardships in life. The father of her son left her, which is why she became a single mother and the head of the family, with her 17-year-old son under her care. Doris has worked hard during a large part of her life, with the drive to get her son ahead and to provide him with everything he needs. Doris has been providing domestic services for various families, but her income is very low and so she turned to another source of income. That's the reason why for the past year or so, she has been selling catalogue merchandise to her friends and family members. That way she's able to get a higher income to pay for her home expenses. Doris has been making very good sales lately, therefore she has some orders to meet and she needs to purchase merchandise. However, at the moment she doesn't dispose of enough capital for that, so she hopes that a loan will allow her to purchase personal use items such as underwear and ladies' blouses, among other products she sells by catalogue. Doris hopes that, by being able to meet her customers' demands, her profits will considerably increase and she will be able to improve her son's living conditions. Doris has a big dream and it is to own a very large business where she can sell to a lot of customers and get higher profits than she does now. Furthermore, she dreams of having her son get a college education so he can be ready for a well-paying job.

loans.use: to purchase personal use products such as underwear, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en: Perla, a 48-year-old married mother of six, lives in the Philippines where, for the past two years, she has operated a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. A member of HSPFI since 2010, she is requesting a loan for PHP 14,000 to buy more stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. In the future, Perla hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy, tiene 44 años, se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos, es madre de 4 hijos, es casada y socia de Finca Perú desde hace 10 años, en todo este tiempo ella pudo aprender la forma correcta para hacer que su negocio pueda crecer, después de una operación que tuvo empezó a dedicarse a la venta de zapatos y ropa porque es un trabajo mas liviano, se siente muy bien en Finca, por todo lo que le brindan las capacitaciones y los préstamos, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de zapatos.
texts.en: Vilma is a member of the Tarpuy communal bank. She is 44 years old and sells clothing and shoes. She is married and the mother of 4 children. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 10 years and during this time she has been able to learn the right way to get her business growing. She started selling clothing and shoes after having surgery, because it's lighter work. She feels very good at FINCA, since they provide her with training and loans. She will use this loan to purchase shoes.

loans.use: to purchase shoes.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.es: Raquel tiene 30 años y está casada con Percy. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Ronaldo, de 9 y Jair de 3 años de edad. Ellos viven en una casa alquilada, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay, distrito de Huasahuasi. Raquel se dedica a la siembra de papa, arveja y habas, hace 19 años aproximadamente. Empezó ayudando a sus padres y así aprendió. La agricultura es su principal actividad económica y lo que más le gusta a ella es poder, salir al campo desde las primeras horas del día a cuidar de sus cultivos, con esa constancia y perseverancia en el trabajo obtiene buenas ganancias en sus ventas de las cosechas en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, donde lleva a vender su producción.  En los meses de junio y julio siembra flores de gladiolos que tiene buena demanda en la zona. Ahora Raquel continua con sus sembríos, por que esta actividad le da ingresos para mantener a sus pequeños hijos y solventar los gastos diarios. Le gusta la agricultura y realizará sus labores hasta que sus fuerzas lo exigan. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Pioneros de Cumutay” y éste sería su crédito número 8 con MFP, donde espera de la colaboración de todos ustedes para continuar con sus planes. Además se compromete en pagar regularmente sus cuotas. Raquel invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de una bolsa de semilla de arveja para su próxima cosecha a fines del mes de enero.
texts.en:
Raqeuel is 30 years old and is married to Percy. They have two children together: Ronaldo, 9 years old, and Jair, 3 years old. They live in a rented house that is located in a rural community called Cumutay, in the district of Huasahuasi. 

For approximately 19 years Raquel has made a living planting potatoes, peas and fava beans. She started by helping her parents and learned from them. Agriculture is her main income generating activity. She likes to be able to leave for the fields in the early morning to go care for her crops. With this consistency and perseverance in the way she works, she results with good profits from the sales of her harvests in the wholesale market in Tarma, where she goes to sell her products. In the months of June and July she grows gladiola flowers, for which there is high demand in the area. 

Now Raquel is continuing with planting, because it allows her to support her small children and pay for daily necessities. She likes agricultural work and will continue working until she is not able to.  

She belongs to the communal bank 'Pioneros de Cumutay'. This is her eighth loan with MFP. She hopes that as a result of the collaboration of lenders, she will be able to continue with her plans. She promises to make her payments on time. Raquel will invest the money she has requested to buy a bag of pea seeds for her next crop, which will be planted at the end of January.

loans.use: to buy a bag of pea seeds.

loans.name: Junaydullo

texts.ru: Чунайдулло житель Гиссарского района. Он женат. Ему 32 года. У него один ребенок. Его жена домохозяйка. Он сам имеет среднее образование. Уже четыре года как он занимается торговлей фруктов. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Junaydullo is a resident of the Gissar district.  He is 32 years old, married and has one child.  His wife is a homemaker.  He has a secondary education.  Junaydullo has been involved in selling fruits for four years.  He is requesting this loan to increase product turnover.

loans.use: to purchase fruits

loans.name: La Iglesia Group

texts.es:
El grupo la Iglesia está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Sadia de 29 años quien tiene una pequeña venta desde hace 2 años la cual inicio con su hermana. Ella invertirá el crédito en productos en especial granos básicos y su meta es que su venta aumente.
Las otras integrantes son Gilma de 53 años quien vende comida desde hace 8 años y  Juana de 32 años quien vende chiverías y helados.
texts.en:
The group La Iglesia is made up of three working women who are entrepreneurs. 

One of them is Sadia who is 29 years old who has had a small business for two years which she began with her sister. She will invest the money from the loan in supplies, especially basic grains and her goal is to see her sales increase.

The other members are Gilma who is 53 years old and has been selling food for eight years and Juana who is 32 year old and sells Chiverías (yogurt) and ice cream.

loans.use: to buy basic grains.

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es: La señora Juana María es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene una  pulpería  de 18 años  por iniciativa propia para salir adelante. El crédito que solicita es de autoestima lo cual utilizara para una consulta médica para ella y su hija en especial por unos estudios para su niña ya que tiene pelotita en la garganta.
texts.en: Juana María is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who has had a small grocery store for 18 years. She started it on her own initiative in order to move forward. She is asking for a loan out of self-esteem, and she will use it for a doctor's visit for herself and her daughter, especially for some tests for her child, since she has a small lump in her throat.

loans.use: to have tests done.

loans.name: Odilia

texts.es: Odilia es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy, tiene 51 años, ella se dedica a la venta de leña y tiene su chacra, es madre de 4 hijos y todos son profesionales, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 15 años, ella siempre puso en práctica todo lo que le enseñaban en Finca, y le enseñaba a sus hijos, ella esta decidida en que desea seguir progresando, y que todos sus hijos puedan tener una estabilidad económica, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en al compra leña.
texts.en: Odilia is a member of the Tarpuy communal bank. She is 51 years old and sells firewood. She owns a small farm and has 4 children, all in the workforce. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for 15 years. She has always put into practice everything she was taught at FINCA, and she also taught her children. She decidedly wants to continue making progress and to see all her children get financial stability. She will use this loan to purchase firewood.

loans.use: to purchase firewood.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Touch, 39, is married and resides with her husband and school-age child in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been growing rice for more than ten years and are successful in this career. Additionally, her husband is a carpenter. In order to improve her husband’s business, Touch is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to purchase a wood planing machine to use in his carpentry work. In the future, she would like to expand her husband’s business, build a kitchen and support her child's education to earn a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a wood planing machine

loans.name: Merita

texts.en:
Merita is 50 years old.  She is married and has five children.

Merita owns and operates a business venture, selling dried goods in the local community.  She has three years of experience in this business.  Merita needs a loan of WST 2,500 to purchase raw ingredients needed such as flour, sugar, oil, and cordials to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to supplement her family's income.

In 2008, Merita joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Merita's fourth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, and cordials to make products for sale

loans.name: Tulili

texts.en:
Tulili is forty two years of age and is married with 6 children.

Tulili owns and operates a business venture, which involves selling dried goods in the local community.  She has 3 years of experience in this business. Tulili needs a loan of WST 1,000 (Talas) to purchase raw ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, and cordials to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 Talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Tulili joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Tulili's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, cordials to make products for sale.

loans.name: Padma Laxmi

texts.en:
Padma Laxmi is 50 years old.  She is married and has 2 children, aged 25 and 20.  In 2001, she established her business making brass religious statues.  Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her business.  In the future, Padma Laxmi plans to improve the economic conditions of her family.  She thanks you for your support.

Nepal has a long and rich history of traditional handicrafts.  Throughout the Kathmandu Valley, skilled artisans produce unique pieces of art that reflect Nepal's cultural diversity.  Terra cotta pottery comes from the red clay of the surrounding Himalayan foothills.  Bronze and silver statuettes are formed using wax molds and intricate hand-tool finishing.  In Patan, Newari culture and traditions are reflected in the images and symbols etched into metal or formed in stone.  With the help of a Kiva loan, Nepal's artisans are able to purchase raw materials in greater volume.  This increase in volume allows a single artisan to work on several pieces at the same time while increasing her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Asentamiento Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
Kuña Guapa Asentamiento Santa Rosa es el grupo de 10 mujeres de la ciudad de Concepción. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia, que se unieron con el propósito de trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo poder ayudar a sus familias y darles un futuro mejor. Todas ellas son vecinas y amigas, es por eso que se ve un gran trabajo en equipo y compañerismo.
Nilda es una de las miembros, ella es una mujer muy sacrificada y nos cuenta que se dedica a las ventas de productos de primera necesidad, como ser azúcar, fideos, arroz y demás. Ella comenta que le va muy bien, pues ella provee a la mayoría de sus vecinos, y eso le ayuda mucho con los ingresos de su hogar.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, fideos, arroz y demás, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener en stock esos productos.
texts.en:
'Kuña Guapa Asentamiento Santa Rosa' is a group of 10 women located in the city of Concepción. They are women who are the heads of their families, who have united with the purpose of working together and in this way be able to better provide for their families and give them a better future. All of the women are neighbors and friends, which is why you can see they have such great teamwork and camaraderie.

Nilda is one of the group members. She is a woman who sacrifices much. She tells us that she makes a living selling staple products, like sugar, noodles, rice and other things. She said that her business is going well and that she provides to the majority of her neighbors. This helps her greatly as a source of income for her home.  

She has requested the loan to buy sugar, noodles, rice and other things with which she will be able to buy stock and have more of these procudts to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, noodles, rice and other things.

loans.name: Minu

texts.en:
Minu is 40 years old. She is married and has two children aged 18 and 14. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid sixth loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to buy ingredients for her business. In the future, Minu plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.
  
Both Mrs. Minu and her husband are engaged in their own businesses. For 10 years they have made papads, colorful chips, snacks, and pickles in their own home, which they sell in grocery shops. Their snacks have become very popular. Mrs. Minu is requesting her seventh loan to purchase more ingredients for their business.

loans.use: to buy food materials for her business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 46-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child.
 
Lolita has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Lolita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jasmine

texts.en:
Jasmine is 20 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Jasmine has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from Natasha and Avon. She has had this business for a year. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stock from Natasha and Avon to sell.

Jasmine has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jasmine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks from Natasha and Avon to sell.

loans.name: Laura Del Carmen

texts.es:
Laura mujer trabajadora, emprendedora junto a su esposo con capacidades diferentes comercializan productos de uso diarios, variedades y más. Su objetivo es mejorar su nivel vida mediante su fuente de trabajo y con el apoyo del financiamiento. El préstamo anterior fue de gran impactó de beneficio ya que lo invirtieron y así mantiene el capital inicial. 
Con este nuevo ciclo de préstamo comprara mercadería variada como: perfumes, cremas de manos, cuerpos y rostros, pinturas de labios, uñas, maquillaje, sombras, delineadores, prendas de ropas y artículos. Desodorantes, tintes para cabellos, lociones, desmaquíllantes entre otros productos aumentando su inventario y así cumplir con los encargos.
Agradece a la financiera por el apoyo continua al desarrollo de su negocio.
texts.en: Laura is a hardworking and enterprising woman. Along with her husband, who is handicapped, she sells daily use products and various merchandise. Her goal is to improve her living conditions through her work and with support from the loan. The previous loan had a big, beneficial impact, because they invested it and therefore maintained their working capital. With this new loan cycle she will purchase various items such as perfumes, hand, body and face creams, lip gloss, synthetic nails, makeup, eyeshadow, eyeliner, garments, toiletries, deodorants, hair dye, lotions, makeup remover, among other products. That way she will stock up and meet her customers' demands. She gives thanks to the financial institution for the continued support in developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase varied merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy, tiene 65 años, se dedica a la compra de ropa y lo lleva a la selva, es madre de 9 hijos, y es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 10 años, y la experiencia que pudo ganar en Finca le ayuda a poder criar bien a sus hijos y que su negocio pueda ser el sustento para su hogar. Maria esta muy agradecida a Finca por las capacitaciones y la ayuda que dan a las mujeres de bajos recursos económicos, aunque fracaso en un tiempo ella salió adelante. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropa de la estación.
texts.en: Maria is a member of the Tarpuy Communal Bank.  She is 65 years old and the mother of nine children.  She sells clothing, which she takes to the rainforest region.  She has been a member of Finca Perú for ten years. The experience that she has gained in Finca has helped her to raise her children well and to make her business profitable so that she can sustain her home.  Maria is very grateful to Finca for the training and assistance that they give to low-income women. Although she was failing at one time, she kept going.  She will use the loan she is requesting to purchase seasonal clothing.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Epifania Morales Luis

texts.es: Epifania es socia del Banco Comunal Tarpuy, tiene 44 años, se dedica a la venta de locería y también cocina en eventos, ella tiene 6 hijos. Epifania es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 5 años, se retiro por mas de un año pero ahora esta volviendo, ella dice que estar en Finca le ayuda a poder trabajar con ganas porque tiene una responsabilidad de traer las cuotas, y que no es como las demás entidades, porque a medida que Finca crece también esta creciendo ella y eso es lo que le impulsa a seguir adelante, ahora este préstamo lo invertirá en al compra de locería.
texts.en: Epifania is a member of the “Tarpuy” communal bank.  She’s 44 years old and sells dinnerware.  She also cooks for events.  She has six children.  Epifania has been a member of FINCA Perú for five years.  She dropped out for more than a year but she’s returning.  She says that being in Finca helps her work more enthusiastically because she has the responsibility of bringing in her installment and that is isn’t like other entities because as Finca grows, so does she and this is what pushes her to continue forward.  She will use this loan to buy dinnerware.

loans.use: to buy dinnerware.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, es una joven de 24 años, que vive en casa de sus padres; junto a su esposo Jaime y su hijo menor Yosmel, de 4 años. Ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Cumutay, distrito de Huasahuasi. La actividad principal de Maribel es la agricultura, de esa manera sustenta  a su joven familia. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa y arvejas. Los cuales siembra hace ya 4 años, y según afirma con el esfuerzo diario, y los constantes cuidados que le brinda en compañía de su esposo, podrá obtener muchas ganancias, y con ello invertir en la compra de más terrenos agrícolas.  Ya está dando el primer paso, con la adquisición de un espacio en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde hace poco comenzó y está obteniendo buenas ganancias, ya que está en un lugar estable. Con estas acciones, ella espera construir su casa propia en uno de sus terrenos ya que más adelante su hijo tendrá que estudiar y para ello necesitan un espacio familiar. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Pioneros de Cumutay” y éste sería su crédito número cuatro con MFP, donde espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Además se compromete en pagar puntualmente con sus cuotas. Agradece por anticipado el apoyo. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de 4 bolsas de semillas de arvejas para iniciar con éxito una siembra. Con lo restante pagará el servicio de los jornaleros que contratará.
texts.en:
Maribel is a young woman of 24 years. She lives in her parents' home with husband, Jaime, and her four-year-old son Yosmel. They live in their own house, which is located in the small village of Cumutay in the district of Huasahuasi. 

Maribel's primary work is in agriculture and this is how she supports her young family. Her main fields are sown with potatoes and peas, which she's grown for four years already. According to Maribel, with daily effort and constant care from her and her husband, she will be able to earn a good profit, which can be invested in the purchase of more agricultural plots. Maribel is already taking the first step: the acquisition of a space in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma, where just recently she started and is earning good profits as it's a stable place. 

With her actions, Maribel hopes to build her own home on one of the plots of land. Looking toward the future her son will have to study and for that they will need a family space. 

Maribel belongs to the community bank Pioneros de Cumutay [Cumutay Pioneers] and this will be her fourth loan with MFP. She hopes for a small loan to help her reach her goals. Furthermore she promises to make her payments on time. In advance she appreciates the support. 

She will invest the money in the purchase of four bags of pea seeds to start off a successful sowing season. She will use the rest to pay for the service of day laborers that she will hire.

loans.use: to buy four bags of pea seeds and to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 37-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.
 
Florita has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 11,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Florita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Florita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is  a fifty-one-years-old lady. She is married and the mother of one child. She practices agricultural activities in Oloitoktok. Mary has been in the business for three years now and gets a monthly income of KES. 11,500.


This will be Mary’s first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to improve her agricultural activities. With the profit that she will get, she wants to expand on her agricultural business. 

In future she wants to be able to farm on a large scale and transport her products.

loans.use: to improve her agricultural activities.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 24-years-old. She is married to Geoffrey and together they have three children ages five years, three years and eight-months-old. She operates a retail shop and has been in the business for the past three years. She gets a monthly income of KES 85,000 from the business.

This is her first loan term from KADET LTD. She will use the loan amount to purchase stocks of cooking fat, sugar and flour for her business.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a registered customer. Her dreams is to open a wholesale venture and improve her financial status.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of  cooking fat, sugar and flour for sale.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is 49-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Lina has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 14,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Lina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mwashamba

texts.en:
Mwanashamba is applying for another loan to start a new retail shop business. She will use this 50,000 Kes loan to purchase stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, rice, sugar and detergents for resale. In the future, Mwanashamba aspires to continue improving her businesses. 

Since taking her last Kiva loan, Mwanashamba has greatly improved her family’s standard of living. She hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, rice, sugar and detergents for resale.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Esterlita has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Esterlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Esterlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 53 years old from Nakuru and is married with two children who are ages eight and 15 years old.

Eunice is a farmer and she normally plants maize. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy some maize seeds to use during this planting season. 

She hopes to be able to be a large scale farmer in the future.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds for planting.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Lourdes has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan for 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods and a variety of beverages.
Lourdes has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Lourdes hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and a variety of beverages for sale.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family.

She has been selling used clothes to businesses in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from vulcanizing.  Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy more used clothes to sell to customers.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is a married woman having three children. Fe is 32 years old, residing at Liloan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Fe owns and operates farm land, where she plants and harvests cassava for sale to earn a living and she has been in this business for 11 years. Each month, she earns 2,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 5,000.00 to purchase additional capital for farming. Fe has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Fe wants to make improvements for her house and to help children finish their education.

loans.use: to gain additional capital for farming

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
Este grupo es de la ciudad de Asunción, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras. Actualmente este comité se encuentra en su 14to. Ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad  de ellas en las actividades y en las reuniones y el deseo de progresar que tienen  cada una de las que integrantes. Son mujeres muy humildes y trabajadoras que realizan actividades grupales para ayudarse mutuamente.
Lidia es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella comenta que tiene mucha creatividad, lo que demuestra en los termos forrados que vende. Dice que le va muy bien, pues de un tiempo para acá las personas compran mucho este producto, lo cual le beneficia mucho. Su meta es poder crecer cada día más y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando en su casa.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de termos, hilos, cuero, cuerina y demás artículos para poder continuar con su negocio. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Asunción. The women are very hardworking and determined. Currently this committee is in the middle of its 14th loan cycle. This highlights the women's sense of responsibility in their activities and meetings, as well as the desire to progress that each of the members has. They are very humble and hardworking women that conduct group activities in order to mutually help one another.

Lidia is one of the members of the group. She says that she's very creative, which is shown in the covered thermoses that she sells. She says that things are going well for her as people are buying a lot of her product, which benefits her a lot. Her goal is to be able to grow more each day and in this way be able to continue helping her household.

She is requesting the loan to buy thermoses, thread, leather, faux leather, and other articles to be able to continue with her business. She is thankful to the foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity that she's receiving.

loans.use: to buy thermoses, thread, leather, faux leather, and other articles.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
Ernesto is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. 
Ernesto has a shop that sells spices, vegetables & food seasonings. He has had this business for 25 years. He requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy spices, vegetables & food seasonings for sale.
Ernesto has been a member of HSPFI for since 2007.  In the future, Ernesto hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy spices, vegetables & food seasonings for sale

loans.name: Recel

texts.en:
Recel is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Recel has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Recel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Recel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a married woman with four children, three of whom are enrolled in school while one is married. Her husband is a teacher who contributes to providing for the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Tatu has operated a food stall for the past 5 years. Her potential clients are the area locals. She faces a major challenge of lack of customers sometimes. She dreams of establishing a café in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, rice, beans and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loan facilities easily.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, rice, beans and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es: La socia es la Sra. Lorenza; La socia continua con la compra y venta de animales menores, la socia sigue invirtiendo su credito en la ciranza de aves de corral y animales menroes y natores en general, ella tiene gallinas, pollos, vacas, chanchos, cuyes, toros; y sigue vendeindo leche y derivados de la leche como mantequilla, queso y yogurth. La socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de una vaca para incrementar su producción y de aves como pollos.
texts.en: Lorenza is a member who continues to buy and sell young animals. She continues to invest her loan in the raising of farmyard birds and young animals. She has hens, chicken, cows, pigs, guinea pigs, and bulls. She continues to sell milk and dairy products like butter, cheese, and yogurt. On this occasion she would like to invest the loan in the purchase of a cow to increase production and of birds like chicken.

loans.use: to buy a cow to increase production and birds like chicken.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 57 years old, a single businesswoman and mother of three children aged 20, 18 and 15 years respectively. She has been selling second-hand clothes for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 9,000 which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Lucy will use the loan to buy stock of used clothes for sale in her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop.

loans.use: To buy stock of used clothes for sale in her business.

loans.name: Almen

texts.en:
Almen is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Almen has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy stock of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Almen has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Almen hopes to improve her business

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Esperanza 2 Group

texts.es:
Esperanza 2 es el comité integrado por 12 integrantes  en donde todas tienen una pequeña actividad a la cual se dedican por más pequeña que sea. Las señoras están muy contentas por formar parte del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya .La ayuda mutua entre ellas es constante y por sobre todo las inspiran en las ganas de seguir luchando por sus familias.
Maria es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de  prendas de todo tipo. Comenta que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha logrado salir adelante, ya que empezó con solo unas cuentas prendas y hoy en día ya tiene muy buena clientela.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar más variedad de prendas, ya que tiene muchos pedidos y quiere poder cumplir con ellos.
texts.en:
Esperanza 2 is a communal bank made up of 12 members, each of whom is dedicated to her own business, no matter how small. The women are very happy to be part of the Program for Enterprising Women of Fundación Paraguaya. The mutual help between them is constant and inspires them above all to continue fighting for their families.

Maria is one of the members of this group. She works selling all kinds of clothing. She notes that she has succeeded in getting ahead through a great deal of effort and sacrifice. She began with only a few accounts and nowadays has a very good customer base. She is requesting a loan to buy a greater variety of garments since she has many orders and wants to be able to fill all of them.

loans.use: to buy clothing for later sale.

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Benjamin is a married man who has three children. Benjamin is 52 years old and resides in Bonfacio, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living and he has been in this business for 10 years. Each month, he earns 4,000 PHP doing this type of business. He requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional products to resell. Benjamin has been a member of GDMPC since 2010. In the future, Benjamin wants to build a house and to finish funding the study of his children.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to resell

loans.name: Blanca Nidia

texts.es: Blanca Nidia es una emprendedora que ha sacado a sus hijas adelante su mayor sueño es que sus hijas culminen sus estudios y ver su negocio bien surtido de productos para ofrecerle a sus clientes. Blanca ya ha trabajado con Fundación León 2000, para invertir en su pulpería, ella nos expresa que gracias al apoyo que se le brindo ella pudo aumentar su mercadería en el negocio lo cual sus clientes llegan a visitarla más por la variedad de producto que tiene. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para comprar más productos como golosinas, refrescos, pan detergente entre otros productos.
texts.en: Blanca Nidia is an entrepreneur that has given her daughters a good start in life. Her greatest dream is for her daughters to complete their studies and to see her business overflowing with products to offer to her customers. Blanca has already worked with Fundación León 2000 to invest in her general store. She tells us that thanks to the support that she was given, she was able to increase her business' merchandise. This has caused her customers to visit her more due to the variety of products that she has. Currently, she is requesting funding to buy more products like sweets, soft drinks, bread, and detergent, among other products.

loans.use: to buy sweets, soft drinks, bread, and detergent, among other products.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a 60-year-old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife and four children. Two of his children are working. As for him, he has big responsibilities toward his family. That’s why he strives to work really hard to be able to offer them a good way of living. 

Adel has been working in candies and roasters trading since 1980. Today, he is looking for a loan of $2,100 from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. to increase his inventory of roasters and sugar candies. In that way, he will be capable of responding rapidly to his clients’ orders.

In the future, he plans to open his own candies and roasters factory.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of roasters and sugar candies.

loans.name: Sari Maju Group

texts.en: Besides using her profit to purchase more piglets, Ni Komang also used her loan to purchase a superior piglet which will be prepared for a sow. She has a dream to be a piglet seller in her village. She hopes her dream will come true and she will be able to pay for the education of her children through to higher levels for their bright future.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” HATUNCHASKAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 44 años de edad, casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias ejerciendo su carrera profesional de docente del nivel inicial ,la socia lleva años ejerciendo su carrera, la socia a la vez le ayuda a su esposo en la venta de postales ya que su esposo es el encargado de fabricar estas postales y la socia le ayuda a vender sus amistades, amigos entre otros, la socia es una persona bien alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para la elaboración de las postales que elabora su esposo.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
This member is 44 years old and belongs to the 'HATUNCHASKAS' communal bank, located in the district of Cusco in Cusco province.

She is married with three children and alternates her daily activities between her career teaching primary level which she has been doing for many years, and helping her husband selling postcards. Her husband makes the postcards himself, and she helps him to sell them to friends and acquaintances, among others. She is a very cheerful and responsible person who is eager to provide for her family.

The member has requested this loan to purchase materials for the production of postcards that her husband makes. She is pleased to have the opportunity for the loan and agrees to comply with the payments.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the production of postcards that her husband makes.

loans.name: Aris Setya Wiguna Group

texts.en: The Aris Setya Wiguna Group needs a new loan to purchase raw materials including wood, sand and cement. Now they have an order to carve at the temple. Usually, they will finish jobs in three months, depending on the size of the carving area. I Putu will manage the group to take orders based on their expertise. This group is very famous now because of their excellent work. The group has many orders and I Putu will manage them and make a schedule. In the future, the group hopes they will have their own capital to run the business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials including wood, sand and cement

loans.name: Buenaventurada

texts.en: 28-year-old Buenaventurada is a married woman with three children, ages 9, 7 and 3. Her husband works as a fisherman and habal-habal (motorcycle taxi) driver. Buenaventurada has been in the fishing business for 11 years. She helps her husband sell fish at the market. She also makes fish traps. Buenaventurada plans to use her loan to buy fishing nets, baits and paint for the boat. She hopes for this loan to help improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, baits and paint for the boat

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. Jocelyn has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 9,000 Philippine pesos to buy stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Antony

texts.en: Antony is 25 years old. He is a retail shop proprietor in Voi. He is single and has been running the shop for the past two years with great success. This is Antony’s second loan from KADET Ltd. to finance his business. He plans to purchase rice, maize flour, sugar and washing powders. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase a piece of land to build a business premises. He hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, maize flour, sugar and washing powders for sale.

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: Mayra, tiene la edad  de 35 años, está en unión libre, vive con su  hijo y su esposo que son su mayor prioridad. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar cerdos pequeños para su posterior engorde. Ella actualmente cuenta con los establecimientos en condiciones regulares para la explotación de estos animales y es por eso que invertirá en ellos. Ella tiene como meta generar los suficientes recursos económicos para salir adelante con el proyecto y tener una estabilidad económica cada día mejor. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Mayra, 35, lives in a common-law relationship.  She lives with her son and husband, who are her greatest priority.  With the loan she plans to buy young pigs to fatten.  Currently she has the business in fair condition to work with these animals, and this is why she will invest in them.  Her goal is to generate sufficient economic resources to get ahead with the project and have better financial stability every day.

This is the first loan she has received from FUDECOSUR.  She had not had other loans in state banks before, but FUDECOSUR offered her a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten.

loans.name: San Juan Group

texts.es:
El comité de nombre SAN JUAN es de la ciudad de Lambaré, son 12 señoras quienes tienen diversas actividades, pero siempre realizan actividades en conjunto para fomentar su compañerismo y también para recaudar fondos de ayuda en caso de necesidad. Ellas son muy reconocidas en el barrio por su unión.
Ilse es una persona muy emprendedora y trabajadora, dice que se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza hechos en la casa. Comenta que le va muy bien, pues sus productos tiene mucho éxito, ya que las personas prefieren sus productos a los que se compran en las tiendas. Su sueño es poder tener una tienda donde pueda ofrecer comodidad y más variedad a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar lavandina, cloro, fragancias, esencias y demás insumos para preparar los productos que vende. Está contenta por la ayuda que les da fundación paraguaya y también kiva.
texts.en:
The San Juan group is from the city of Lambaré. They are 12 women who work doing a variety of jobs, but they always do activities together to strengthen their partnership and also to collect funds to have to help in times of need. They are known in their neighborhood for their solidarity.

Ilse is a very entrepreneurial and hard-working person. She says she works selling homemade cleaning products. She shares that it going very well for her, and that her products have a lot of success and are preferred over store bought products. Her dream is to have a store where she can offer convenience and greater variety to her customers.

She is asking for a loan to buy bleach, fragrances, oils, and other supplies to prepare the products she sells. She is happy for the help provided to her by the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

loans.use: buy bleach, fragrances, oils, and more to make cleaning products

loans.name: Nodir

texts.ru: Нодир житель Яванского района. Ему 30 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Его брат работает продавцом в продуктовом магазине. Нодир вместе со всей семьей и родителями занимается растениеводством. Кроме того он занимается животноводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Nodir lives in the Yavan region. He is 30 years old, married, and has a child. His brother works as a salesperson in a grocery store. Nodir, his family and his parents grow crops. Nodir also raises farm animals, which he has been doing for four years. He is taking the loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Sandra Zuleyma

texts.es: Sandra es una joven madre  de 25 años de edad, es conviviente con 03 hijos aún dependientes. Ella se dedica al servicio domestico, la cual brinda servicios de limpieza y de cocina, lleva trabajando de esta  manera más 02 años. Lo que pudo ahorrar con sus trabajos y con la ayuda de conyugue para la compra de un carro la cual lo trabaja su esposo brindando servicio de transporte. Sandra se siente orgullosa pues con su trabajo y dedicación a ayudo a sacar adelante a su familia.  Contar con un negocio propio es su mayor deseo, pues a futuro piensa comprar  computadoras y así poder alquilarlas. Ella solicito el crédito para hacerles algunos arreglos a su vivienda como pintado y entre otro. Sandra agradece el crédito brindado.
texts.en: Sandra is a young mother. She is 25 years old, and lives with her common-law husband and three children who are dependent upon her. She works in housekeeping, providing cooking and cleaning services, and has done this work for more than two years. They bought a care with the money she was able to save from her job and with the help of her husband, who uses this car providing transportation service. Sandra is proud that her work and dedication have helped her family get ahead. Her greatest dream is to have her own business, and in the future she plans to buy computers and rent them out. She is asking for a loan to make some improvements to her home, such as painting and others. Sandra is thankful for the loan.

loans.use: fix up her home

loans.name: Shirley Elena

texts.es:
Shirley tiene 34 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada San Carlos, en la segunda provincia de Costa Rica, Alajuela. En una zona donde se ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña. Produce además granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), frutas, legumbres, tubérculos y hortalizas. Y en esta provincia está ubicado el Aeropuerto Internacional Juan Santamaría, el más importante del país.

Desde hace unos meses que Shirley se dedica a la artesanía y decoración, ya que cuenta con el apoyo y ayuda de su familia, siente que puede continuar con este negocio,  pero le falta lo principal para que su negocio surja y para que los vecinos de su comunidad se vean beneficiados.  

Es por eso que ella está solicitando un préstamo por el monto de ¢500,000.00 (quinientos mil colones), esto para la compra de materiales para continuar trabajando sus manualidades en cerámica y tela.  

Shirley es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Batán, en una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer crédito y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Shirley is 34 years old and lives with her family in the community of San Carlos, in Costa Rica's second province, Alajuela. This zone is the nation's top producer of coffee and sugar cane. They also produce basic grains (rice, beans, corn), fruits, legumes, tubers, and vegetables. The Juan Santamaría Airport is also here, and it is the most important airport in the country.

Shirley has been working in crafts and decorating for a few months, now that she can count on her family's help and support. She feels she can continue with her business but lacks the capital to grow her business so her neighbors in her community desire her products. For this reason she is asking for a loan of ¢500,000.00 (500,000 colones) to buy materials to keep making her ceramic and fabric crafts.

Shirley is a member of the Batán Community Credit Union, one of 150 member organizations in EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan, and with it, she hopes to continue growing on a personal and economic level. She also hopes to be an active participant of the lending organization in her community.

loans.use: materials for crafts

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa Rosa  se formó con la unión de 13 vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.  Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que ven en el programa de la fundación una gran ayuda. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente que les ayudan a fortalecer su compañerismo.
La Señora Agustina es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica  a la venta de plantas de todo tipo y también de abono. Ella ya no tiene hijos chicos y su marido es constructor de obras. Comenta que se sacrifica mucho para poder ayudar a su marido con los gastos de la casa y de esa forma poder hacer las ligero todo. Su meta es poder tener un gran vivero de plantas, donde tendrá mucha variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de plantas y también de  abonos para poder abastecerse con ellos y de esa forma hacer frente a pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank Santa Rosa was formed by the union of 13 neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. They are very hardworking and striving women who see a great help in the foundation's program. The members formed a group that is very united and capable of achieving together, which helps them to strengthen their comradeship.

Señora Agustina is one of the members of the group. She sells plants of all types and also fertilizer. She no longer has young children, and her husband does construction work. She comments that she sacrifices a lot to be able to help her husband with the household expenses and in this way to be able to make everything easier. Her goal is to be able to have a large nursery for plants, where she will have a great variety to offer to her customers. She is applying for a loan for the purchase of plants and also fertilizer so that she can be well stocked and in this way ready for the orders of her customers.

loans.use: to buy plants and fertilizer to sell

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
El Sr. Tomas es de la ciudad de Encarnación, es casado, tiene dos hijos y comenta que su familia es su principal pilar y quienes lo inspiran a poder seguir adelante.
El tiene un local comercial alquilado donde se dedica a la venta de cubiertas y al servicio de gomera sobre una avenida principal de la ciudad. Comenta que su taller es el medio principal con el cual el puede tener los medios necesarios para poder dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones.
El solicita la ayuda de la fundación paraguaya y de Kiva, para la compra de cubiertas, cámaras y demás artículos necesarios para la gomería, ya que siempre está con muchos pedidos y trabajos.
texts.en:
Tomas is from the city of Encarnación, and is married with two children. He says that his family is his mainstay and they inspire him to succeed. He rents a shop on a main avenue in the city where he sells tires and provides tire repair services. He says that his shop is the primary means he has to give his family everything they need for a dignified life without hardship.

Tomas requests the assistance of Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva to purchase tires, tubes and other items necessary to run the tire shop, as he is always busy with many orders and jobs.

loans.use: to purchase tires and tubes for the tire repair shop

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio, tiene la edad  de 54 años, está divorciado, pero vive actualmente con una compañera o pareja. El con el crédito quiere comprar los insumos para la asistencia de sus cerdos como lo son el concentrado  y los medicamentos. El tiene cerdas de cría y necesita asistir sus animales para que no tengan problemas de nutrición y sus lechones nazcan en buenas condiciones y aptos para la venta al mercado local. El tiene como meta generar las mejores ganancias para el bienestar de su familia y tener cada día una mejor estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Antonio, 54, is divorced but currently lives with a companion or partner.  With the loan he wants to buy the supplies for the care of his pigs, which are concentrated feed and medicine.  He has breeding sows and he needs to take care of them so they do not have nutrition problems, and so their piglets are born healthy and fit to sell to the local market.  His goal is to generate the best profits for the well-being of his family and to have better financial stability every day.

This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He had not had previous loans in state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy feed to take care of his pigs.

loans.name: Americo

texts.es:
